Job Description:
Summary

The Continuous Improvement Manager needs to have a passion for not being satisfied with the status quo. Complacency is NOT something that a CI Manager adheres to. They are motivated to pursue positive change and work with employees in facilitating recommended changes. A successful continuous improvement specialist has excellent verbal and written communication skills and an ability to communicate with all levels of employees from upper management to production floor workers. They work with all positions to explain the reasons for changing processes and how to make those changes. Using Lean Six Sigma methodologies, the continuous improvement specialist leads the improvement efforts and trains others to implement them.

Being organized and adept at weighing and managing priorities is key for a successful Continuous Improvement Manager since there can be competition for what is handled and when. Using keen analytical skills and synthesizing information comes into play when determining how current processes can be improved.

The Continuous Improvement Manager is responsible for assessing, monitoring, and enhancing business performance for our organization. In this role, the Continuous Improvement Manager will analyze current practices and develop business process improvements as well as implement changes in workflows, structures, and teams to ensure continuous company performance.

To ensure success a Continuous Improvement Manager should be a skilled communicator and be adept at business analysis and project implementation. An exceptional Continuous Improvement Manager will understand the latest management methodologies and embody top leadership principles and styles in their management duties.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Duties will include, but are not limited to:

Clearly define program objectives and scope.

Evaluating and prioritizing potential improvements based on gains and required effort and identifying opportunities for process improvement, waste removal, and cost reduction.

Securing employee commitment (ex: process managers) for proactive change management.

Establishing a clear and well-articulated implementation plan and then facilitating, teaching, leading, coaching, and executing continuous improvement events using Lean Six Sigma tools and methodology.

Working to continuously improve processes both on the production floor as well as transactional by collaborating with multiple functions such as logistics.

6. Establishing criteria for the project’s success and preparing a sound statement of constraints/limiting factors

7. Appropriately implementing principles of governance.

8. Resolving technical problems such as formulation, equipment, product, interpretation of regulations, and resource availability.

9. Conducting detailed analysis of the current situation that accurately describes the issues, identifies intervention priorities and indicators, and specifies deliverables, outcome indicators, and performance-measured indicators.

10. Identifying available resources (for example, people, material, and finances)

11. Clearly defining methodology and mapping out in detail the desired situation

12. Accurately analyzing options including impact and feasibility

13. Specifying obstacles and ways to overcome them through continuous improvement.

1. Regularly monitoring the implementation of solutions to achieve objectives and expected benefits Analyzing company processes and procedures.

2. Monitoring staff performance and organizational processes.

3. Collaborating with other stakeholders to enhance productivity and staff satisfaction.

4. Staying current with developments in management and process optimization.

5. Perform other duties as necessary.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Additionally, they must fulfill essential job function in a consistent state of alertness and safe manner. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Hard Skills:

· Continuous Improvement

· 5S

· Lean Manufacturing

· Kaizen

· Lean Six Sigma

· Root Cause Analysis

· Value Stream Mapping

· Proficiency in commonly used and specialized software

· Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Suite, including advanced skills with Excel

· Demonstrated ability to work in high paced and changing environments

Education and/or Experience

· Bachelor’s degree in business management, business, or related field preferred

· Minimum of 5 years’ previous experience as a plant manager, operations or production manager, or related position

· Strong management skills with ability to supervise multiple teams.

· A sharp eye for identifying weak points in processes and organizational structures.

· A strategic and analytical mindset.

· An excellent communicator with top-notch presentation skills.

· A thorough understanding of the latest process enhancement strategies.

· Dynamic thinking and problem-solving abilities.

· Able to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.

· Leadership, team building, and mentoring skills.

· Confidence in your abilities to lead organizational change.

· Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management

· In-depth knowledge of food industry

· Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently.

· Excellent conflict-resolution and decision-making abilities

Computer Skills

· Strong knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office Applications including Outlook, Excel, Word, and ERP system use.

Language Skills

· Ability to effectively communicate with managers, vendors, customers, and other employees of the organization.

Mathematical Skills

· Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as proportions and percentages

Reasoning Ability

· Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.

· Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Physical Demands

· While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or touch objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear.

· The employee is required to stand, walk, and climb or balance. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move files, boxes, etc. weighing up to 50 pounds.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

In our Work Environment, employees demonstrate their skills, teamwork, and leadership by the example they set for the people they serve. Employees are concerned not just with their own duties but additionally, how they can assist those on their left and those on their right.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Position Summary: The Customer Operations Analyst provides support to ConsortiEX™ customers at health systems throughout the country. In this role, you will review and validate compliance documentation from our customers, and input this data into our software. You will interact via email and phone directly with customers to communicate and resolve issues. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to learn and grow in an exciting startup environment.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

· Verify accuracy and completeness of documentation in accordance with compliance requirements.

· Data enter customer data by inputting text and numerical information from source documents – doing additional research and verification as necessary to ensure accuracy.

· Review data for deficiencies or errors, correct if possible, and verify output.

· Clearly communicate and resolve issues with customers via email or phone.

· Provide professional and friendly customer service.

· Follow standard work guidelines, and work to document and improve standards as necessary.

· Maintain confidentiality of information.

Competencies:To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following.

· Customer Service- Displays courtesy and sensitivity. Manages difficult or emotional customer situations. Meets commitments. Responds promptly to customer needs. Solicits customer feedback to improve service.

· Communication– Demonstrates strong communication skills. Able to clearly articulate a problem and determine the appropriate solution. Communicates clearly via email or phone.

· Problem Solving- Develops alternative solutions. Gathers and analyzes information skillfully. Identifies problems in a timely manner. Resolves problems in early stages. Works well at group problem solving situations.

· Continuous Learning- Assesses own strengths and weaknesses. Pursues training and development opportunities. Seeks feedback to improve performance. Shares expertise with others. Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills.

· Use of Technology- Adapts to new technologies. Demonstrates required skills. Keeps technical skills up to date. Troubleshoots technological problems. Uses technology to increase productivity.

INVESTMENT AND RESEARCH OPERATIONS ANALYST Full-Time

Wausau – Dudley Tower Office

JOIN OUR TEAM!

If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in a professional and fun work environment, look no further than WoodTrust Bank! We value every associate and appreciate the importance each individual role contributes to our success. We are currently seeking a motivated, detail-oriented person for an Investment Operations and Research Analyst in our Investment Management and Trust department at our Wausau office.

WHY WE’RE DIFFERENT

Did You Know?

At over $5 billion in client assets under management and $650 million in bank assets, WoodTrust is one of the largest privately owned, full service financial institutions headquartered in central and northern Wisconsin, serving individual, family, corporate and not-for-profit customers in 35 states. With an acute focus on our core value, the customer is #1, WoodTrust has succeeded as a quality, community-focused financial institution since its founding in 1891.

In addition to our pursuit of life-time customers, we seek to provide associates an environment that allows them to learn, grow and succeed with an emphasis on hiring for the long-term and incentivizing teammates to spend the duration of their careers with WoodTrust. If you are interested in a career in financial services, want to work with fun and talented professionals, and grow with a private, family- owned organization, you would be a great fit for our team!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN INVESTMENT OPERATIONS AND RESEARCH ANALYST
As an Investment Research and Operations Analyst, you will:

Provide regular reporting on performance (absolute and vs. benchmarks), asset allocation and trends
Assist Portfolio Managers as needed with trading, transaction processing and account maintenance
Oversee corporate actions, corporate litigations, proxy-voting, in-out of balance monitoring, security pricing and worthless/non-transferrable securities
Coordinate, develop and maintain customized presentation materials for internal and external use
Perform both bottom-up and top-down research and security analysis on behalf of the Research Committee across various asset classes and investment programs
Assist in the creation of written client communication materials

The candidate for this position should have an interest in investment communication and reporting, securities trading, and investment analysis. Education or past experience should reflect this interest.

The Investment Operations and Research Analyst will report directly to our Director of Research and will have significant interaction with the firm’s Investment Committee and Research Committee, client service team and third-party managers.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

A Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business or Economics is preferred
1-3 years of experience in an investment operations or research capacity is preferred
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel and PowerPoint, specifically)

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Attention to detail, a high degree of accuracy and the ability to multi-task are essential to this position as well as a solid understanding of math concepts, good written communication skills and a desire to solve problems. Other beneficial qualities include assertiveness, the ability to make timely decisions as well as take and give good direction. This position will require the person to work a minimum of 40 hours per week.

Must enjoy people and be willing and eager to interact pleasantly with customers and fellow associates alike. Must understand the team concept and be able to function as a member of a team as the team works towards a common goal. It is essential to observe the strictest secrecy and confidentiality regarding accounts and activities of any kind dealing with the bank.

WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?
WoodTrust strives to be an employer of choice, placing a major emphasis on personal and professional development. We offer competitive pay, a full benefit package including medical, dental, vision, vacation, sick leave and a 401(k) matching program along with a bank-wide annual bonus sharing program.

Please submit your application and resume by email or in person at one of our branch locations in Wisconsin Rapids, Plover or Wausau, WI.

WoodTrust is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

September 2023

GENERAL: Business analysts are the drivers of our continued growth and success. From researching progressive systems solutions to evaluating their impacts, the ideal candidate will be a detailed planner, expert communicator, and top-notch analyst. science or supply chain management

Job Summary:
As the EHS Manager, you will develop, implement, and coordinate the plant safety and health programs in accordance with corporate and facility directives to prevent accidents, ensure an ongoing safety culture, and compliance with OSHA and all related federal, state, and local regulations. You will collaborate with production and manufacturing teams to identify potential safety issues and create strategies to mitigate risk and develop and reinforce safety culture. You will develop, implement, and deliver EHS training and education for team members, including new employee safety orientation.
You will communicate effectively with a diverse set of internal customers and implement communication strategies that reinforce a high level of EHS awareness throughout the organization. This function supports approximately 130 manufacturing employees and has two direct reports.
This position is located at our Germantown, WI facility.
Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, Health & Safety, or related program of study
5+ years of related experience in an EHS position within a manufacturing environment, preferably in a welding shop or metal fabrication operation
Preferred: Certified Industrial Hygiene (CIH) or Certified Safety Professional (CSP)
Ability to travel up to 4 times a year
Knowledge, Technical Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge, understanding, and compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations relating to job duties (OSHA, EPA)
Ergo job hazard analysis and improvement
Incident investigation and root cause analysis
Experience with behavioral based systems
Project management and change management
Emergency Response Planning
RCRA Hazardous Waste Management
Strong verbal and written communications
Excellent interpersonal and team skills - ability to work within cross functional teams and build rapport within all levels, support/lead initiatives across the organization
Analytical, organizational, and documentation skills and strong problem solving and business analysis skills
Ability to manage multiple project tasks and adapt to changing priorities
Highly developed computer skills; fluent with productivity application skills - Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Teams), SharePoint, ERP, etc.
Valid driver’s license with good record
Responsibilities & Additional Job Details:
Conduct regular safety audits and inspections to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety regulations
Lead a cross-functional safety committee, engaging and inspiring team members by communicating the team vision, mentoring others, and providing technical support
Participate in detailed incident investigation teams to determine root causes and corrective and preventive actions
Maintain accurate safety records and documentation to ensure compliance with regulatory agencies
Responsible for OSHA logs and environmental reporting for federal and state compliance
Schedule, conduct, monitor monthly EHS inspections and closure of action items
Lead and manage risk assessment process to include Job Hazard Analysis, Ergo Job Hazard Analysis, and other safety assessments with the determination of effective controls and risk mitigation
Interface with federal, state, and local environmental and safety agencies on plant issues
Interpreting laws and regulations to determine applicability for facilities of responsibility and implementing programs to comply
Implement a communication strategy across your plant that reinforces a high level of EHS awareness and ownership at all levels of the plant

Job Title: Software Product Analyst/IT Business Analyst (Hybrid Work Model)
Job Description:
At Sentry, we’re more than just insurance—and we can offer you more than just a job. We want you to enjoy a career with us, where you’re in the driver’s seat of your career path with access to resources to help you succeed personally and professionally.

What You’ll Receive

You want a positive work/life balance. Our hybrid work model allows you to enjoy the benefits of working from home on Monday and Friday, but also provides the opportunity for team building and collaboration when working in the office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. To help you work effectively and comfortably in both locations, we provide you with equipment to work at home and in the office.

You can enjoy a complete benefits package, including generous paid time off, 8% 401(k) match, matching charitable gift program, bonus plan based on company performance, meal stipends, associate discounts, and volunteer time off.

About Sentry

Our background: We’re one of the largest and most financially secure mutual insurance groups in the nation. More than 4,000 strong, our associates bring together diverse backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets to make Sentry who we are. We’re No. 658 on the Fortune 1000 list and named one of America’s Best Midsize Employers by Forbes. We’re in the business of helping others, and that includes the communities where we live and work. Our annual United Way campaign has raised more than $1 million for the past seven years.

Our Stevens Point campus offers a full-service fitness center, swimming pool, basketball and racquetball courts, auto center, credit union, on-site Aspirus clinic, restaurants, boutique hotel, and the award-winning SentryWorld golf course.

This position can be filled as a Software Product Analyst or Senior Software Product Analyst based on the qualifications and experience of the selected candidate.

What You’ll Do

You’re a valuable contributor. As an associate at Sentry, we believe in your skills and knowledge. Your input and participation matters. You’ll have the opportunity to:

Innovate: Through our scaled agile development process, you’ll have dedicated time to apply your creativity and innovation to drive new solutions.

Learn: Sentry provides several resources for furthering your career and continuing your personal development, including Sentry University, LinkedIn Learning, and developer-led educational sessions and communities.

Grow: Sentry provides many opportunities to grow in your career. Through meaningful, ongoing conversations around growth and development, we encourage all associates to take ownership in their career path.

Contribute: Our Software Product Analysts at Sentry are essential to our success of continuing to be innovative and competitive. As an Analyst you’ll:

Participate in discussions and interact with business users and customers to fully understand their business processes and work environment. Observe how they use software systems to do their job, and brainstorm ways to help them be more efficient and effective.

Learn to write crisp, concise requirements and user scenarios that clearly capture what the users want and help engineering bring them to life in software.

Learn to create comprehensive test cases to validate new system features. Work closely with engineering to ensure the system works and performs as intended. Work to anticipate users’ actions to find hidden system defects.

Gain a full understanding of how we develop software and provide ideas and perspective on how we could do it better. Develop a basic technical understanding. Be able to explain the technical building blocks and how information flows within our systems to users of the applications.

If you have experience or knowledge in one of the preferred skills listed above, we want you to consider joining the Sentry team!

How You’ll Apply

We’d love for you to join us. Please complete your online application and upload your resume on our Careers site. If you have applied with us before, you only need to provide your email address and password. If this is your first time applying with Sentry, please create an account.

If you have specific questions regarding the position, application process, or are interested in learning more about Sentry, please reach out to Katelynne Rivera, Talent Acquisition Specialist.

Get ready to own your future at Sentry. Your opportunity awaits.

Talent Acquisition Specialist

Thank you for your interest in Sentry!

Katelynne Rivera

KATELYNNE.RIVERA@SENTRY.COM

The Procurement Section of STAR is hiring for their new Business Analyst! The Program Office is seeking a procurement & purchasing management to evaluate existing system functionality as well as design and test new solutions for the State of WI.

Located in downtown Madison, the State Transforming Agency Resources Program Office (STAR) is an efficient and reliable enterprise-wide system designed to provide better consistency among state agencies as well as a modernization of the State's IT infrastructure. STAR maintains the state's finance, budget, procurement, business intelligence and human resource functions.

This position will have the option of working remotely upon agreement of the supervisor but may be asked to come into the office periodically. This schedule may change based on operational needs and organizational requirements.


STAR strives to be a great place to work. In addition to meaningful and rewarding work, we offer a competitive benefits package featuring:
Substantial leave time including at least 3.5 weeks of vacation to start, 9 paid holidays, and ample accrued sick time that rolls over each year.
Excellent and affordable health, vision, and dental benefits
A casual office atmosphere, flexible work schedules, and remote work options depending on the position’s requirements
An exceptional pension plan with employer match and lifetime retirement payment, plus an optional tax advantaged 457 retirement savings plan
Well Wisconsin Wellness Program
A free and confidential employee assistance program that offers employees and their immediate family dependents a variety of tools, resources, and professional consultation services to support their health, goals, and overall well-being

Join an organization that strives to exceed customer expectations by delivering efficient, high-quality state government services. The Department of Administration (DOA) provides direct services to state agency customers and designs and leads initiatives to make government more innovative and cost-effective. Working at DOA offers you the opportunity to make an impact on the quality of life in Wisconsin.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging are core values at DOA that guide how we build our teams, develop our leaders, and create a culture that empowers everyone to be their authentic selves. We believe that when employees are respected and valued for who they are and are accountable for demonstrating that respect to others; it drives greater engagement and collaboration, ignites creativity and innovation, and fosters connection between teams and those we serve.

Position Summary



Under the general direction of the STAR (State Transforming Agency Resources) Program Office Procurement Section Chief, the Business Analyst serves as a business authority, resolving customer problems and is considered a functional system expert in regard to procurement and purchasing management. This position is responsible for ensuring data integrity and protecting sensitive information through advanced analysis/research and recommending solutions, policies and procedures; evaluating system functionality; design, testing, and documentation of the State’s ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) System within the Procurement Section.

The incumbent is an active member of the STAR Program Office. The STAR Program Office consists of Financial, Procurement, Human Resource, IT leads and change management staff. This position is accountable to demonstrate a commitment to customer service, organizational success and respect in the workplace. Incumbent provides customer service and expert system consultation to internal and external customers including state agencies, Courts, and Legislature. The incumbent participates in Statewide User Group meetings, which focus on utilizing the system efficiently and effectively. The incumbent serves as a liaison with the other STAR Support teams, State agencies, ensuring adherence to State and Federal policies, procedures, rules and regulations related to ERP systems. The incumbent is expected to be accountable for delivering measurably high-quality and responsive services and customer support.

For more information, please view the complete position description.
Salary Information



Starting salary for the IS Enterprise Business Analyst Specialist (07-33) will be between $33.49- $51.37 hourly. Salary will be determined by applicant qualifications. A 12-month probationary period is required. Pay for current state employees will be in accordance with the State Compensation Plan.

Job Details



Due to the nature of the position, DOA will conduct fingerprinting and/or background checks on applicants prior to selection. DOA does not sponsor work visas. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States, and to complete the required employment eligibility form upon hire.

Certain positions within this Department may allow remote/work from home flexibility for a portion of their work schedule, depending on the needs of the position and the work unit. This topic and any remote work flexibility that may be available will be discussed in more detail in the interview process.

Qualifications


Minimally qualified applicants will have the following:
Experience with business process design and documentation
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning systems such as Peoplesoft, SAP, or similar.
Experience in procurement analysis and reporting
How To Apply



Apply online! To apply, click “Apply for Job” to start the application process. Then, you will access your existing account or to create a new account if you don’t have an account. Once you are logged in, click “Apply for Job.” Follow the steps outlined in the application process and submit your application. Please visit the Frequently Asked Questions section for general wisc.jobs user information and technical assistance.

Your letter of qualifications and resume are very important parts of your application and are used during our evaluation process to determine your qualifications as they relate to the job. Please review instructions on developing your resume and letter of qualifications. Your cover letter is limited to a maximum of two (2) typed pages, single-spaced, no smaller than 10-point font, with 1-inch margins. Resumes should be limited to no more than two (2) pages (no format requirements). Pages more than the specified limits may not be evaluated. References are not necessary at this stage of the process.

Submitted materials will be evaluated and the most qualified applicants will be invited to participate in the next step of the hiring process for available vacancies.

Permanent classified state employees who are eligible for consideration (transfer or voluntary demotion) should complete the application process as described above by the stated deadline.

The State of Wisconsin is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer seeking a diverse and talented workforce. Veterans, women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants and employees with disabilities.

If you are a veteran with a 30% or greater service-related disability and are not currently employed in a permanent position with Wisconsin State Government, please send a cover letter, resume, DD-214 and documentation of your service-connected disability rating (dated within 12 months) to the contact listed below.

Questions can be directed to Taylore Ransom by email at taylore.ransom@wisconsin.gov .

The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented Implementation Business Analyst I who will serve as a liaison among project stakeholders to understand business process, structure, policies, and operations of the organization with the goal of documenting requirements that will help deliver new and enhanced processes, products, and services. The Implementation Business Analyst is an external, client-facing role which assists in formulating recommendations that enable the organization or business unit to achieve its goals.

Day in the Life

Facilitates requirements for medium to large complexity projects to Implementation Engineer resources for build, and to Implementation QC resources for generating test cases.
Ensures requirements are testable and complete.
Provides evaluation of proposed solutions, defines configuration parameters used by Implementation Engineer resources in building the system, and further assess the deployed solution to ensure delivered results meet the needs or the business and/or client.
Helps define estimate, scope and requirements documentation and uses appropriate templates across all projects.
Utilizes methods of elicitation, requirements gathering, requirements analysis and solution assessment and validation. Understands stakeholder environment, prioritizing and refining requirements to meet the needs of the client and organization.
Assists in the evaluation of proposed solutions, ensures initial unit testing of all changes is completed, and further assess the deployed solution to ensure delivered results meet the needs of the business and or client.
Ensures the development of all project scope and requirement documents are completed and signed off on by internal business partners and clients. Uses an iterative approach, involving business and clients to ensure needs and requirements are well defined.
Communicates effectively, consistently, and iteratively with internal business partners and clients to ensure the understanding of appropriate business processes, requirements, and project timelines.
Follows change control and appropriate change management processes.
Develops working relationships with clients and internal business partners/ project team members to effectively communicate and support the successful delivery of Co-op Solutions implementations.

Experience

1-3 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a Project Management role required.
Experience modeling/ mapping current to future state business processes required.
Experience performing current state analysis of existing business systems, applications and functions required.
Experience in test planning, test case development and execution preferred.
Experience with both traditional Waterfall SDLC and Agile/ Lean methodologies preferred.
Knowledge of SharePoint preferred.
Knowledge of finance, credit card systems and data sources is preferred.

At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.

What’s the role?

As the Senior Business Analyst for the HR PMO , you will play a pivotal role supporting strategic HR initiatives and the full portfolio of HR project work. Your expertise will contribute to shaping our HR strategies, optimizing operational processes, and HR portfolio delivery.

You will partner with project design leads and project managers to understand project objectives. Your attention to detail and proactive approach will support streamlined project scoping, setting the stage for successful project execution. By translating functional business requirements into clear technical and data requirements, you will facilitate effective communication with other COEs, support teams, and downstream departments.

Collaborating cross-functionally, you will evaluate the resourcing needs for successful project implementation. Leveraging your deep understanding of our organization's HR landscape and enterprise context, you will assess the impact of change on the enterprise and HR. By developing and recommending success measures and OKRs, you will support the HR PMO in measuring project performance and milestones, aligning initiatives with overall strategies.

You will outline funding requirements, dependencies, risks, and blockers, ensuring effective project coordination. By leveraging your strong communication skills, ability to synthesize inputs, and ability to flex up and down the organizational hierarchy, you will facilitate collaboration across teams, ensuring clear and comprehensive project documentation for successful project execution. Your exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail shine through in your ability to provide accurate and timely support for project managers and stakeholders. You facilitate smooth project execution and enable alignment towards project success.

Key Skills and Competencies for the Role:

Learning agility, discernment, and good judgment

Experience in or solid understanding of HR Tech, Data/Analytics, Shared Services, Embedded HR, and COEs

Strong communication skills, with the ability to flex up and down organizationally and synthesize disparate inputs

Excellent organizational context, with the ability to build and maintain relationships

An analytical mindset and high business acumen; experience developing metrics to measure outcomes and activity

Open-mindedness and negotiation skills, with the ability to build trust and establish effective relationships

Self-direction and a proactive approach.

Additional Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., business, HR, analytics)

3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role

Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools

Strong proficiency in data analysis and OKR development

Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) is a plus

Compensation Range:

Pay Range - Start:

$73,570.00

Pay Range - End:

$136,630.00

Northwestern Mutual pays on a geographic-specific salary structure and placement in the salary range for this position will be determined by a number of factors including the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; the scope, complexity as well as the cost of labor in the market; and other conditions of employment. At Northwestern Mutual, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. Your Job

KBX is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who will work closely with members of Support, Operations, Purchasing and Business Development teams to evaluate trends though the design and development of reports and the analysis and interpretation of data using, SQL, Microsoft Power BI, SSRS, Excel and a variety of development and visualization tools. This includes the development of database tools, data analysis to evaluate the service and cost of KBX, and provision of data support for various programs and ad hoc reports.

Our Team

The Business Intelligence and Automation team, comprising 10 diverse members with various skills and experiences, fosters inclusivity as a central tenet. Regardless of backgrounds, our team values every member's input, creating an open and respectful work environment. Collaboration is a cornerstone of our approach, involving not only internal teamwork but also engagement with stakeholders and customers. We actively seek feedback and embrace challenges, reflecting a growth-oriented mindset. We excel in striking a balance between being independent and interdependent work, making us a dynamic and effective group for achieving outstanding results in various projects and tasks.

What You Will Do

Create and deliver analytics to operations and the business to lower our total transportation cost and improve dedicated utilization
Dive into the data and systems to understand what is driving\impacting the key metrics and results
Interpreting results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining
Writing queries to extract data and build visualizations/analytical models to support business needs and fulfill business requirements
Designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining business solutions
Synthesizing large amounts of information while maintaining rigorous attention to detail
Collaborating with business requestors and IT developers to implement new enhancements and innovations; understanding the implications enhancements will have on data structures and query effectiveness
Reviewing data and reporting to ensure data integrity and compliance to standard reporting
Leverage SQL or other programing languages to structure data to extract and organize consumable data sets
Effectively influence, communicate, and build relationships with teammates, internal and external customers
Develop data visualization tools in Power BI and SSRS to enable users to find key trends

Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)

Experience writing complex transactional data queries to integrate into other applications via languages such as R or Python or SQL
Experience using math and analytical skills in a professional environment
Experience working with Microsoft Office Excel writing complex formulas, pivot tables and vlookups
Experience articulating and educating data findings to customer or stakeholders
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

What Will Put You Ahead

Associate degree or higher
Experience with the use of Microsoft Power BI for data visualizations
Experience integrating data via Microsoft Power Automate solutions
Experience leveraging data from SnowFlake
Experience writing technical queries in Python or R
Experience in the analytical or logistics industry

The Business Intelligence Analyst supports end-to-end data management across the CapSpecialty ecosystem. In addition, the Business Analyst partners with various business and IT stakeholders to deliver new solutions as well as maintain the existing business intelligence solutions. This role will work to proactively identify issues and gaps in our data assets and/or data environment and work to find solutions to fix the root cause. This will also include working with business and IT stakeholders to help them articulate issues and turn reported issues into concise development requirements to close the issue/gap. This role will strive, with the rest of the data team, to make sure the business intelligence solutions are prioritized, built, tested, and deployed in a timely manner.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Serve as a technical data liaison between business users, systems, and analytical teams

Support and maintain current Business Intelligence tools and solutions.
Build and expand business intelligence skill set. As new processes and/or tools are introduced into the data environment, work to learn new technologies and methodologies to enable support. Work to understand tools and processes across the entire data pipeline, enabling the identification of root causes across any step in the data pipeline.
Assist with the development of test strategies, writing and executing functional test cases, developing test execution plans, assessing defect severity, providing a status of testing activities and driving defects/issues to resolution.
Improve business acumen as it pertains to the insurance industry and/or develop functional domain expertise within BI related disciplines (e.g., database design, report/dashboard design, statistical modeling, etc.).
Leverage business knowledge and expertise to drive business process improvements.

Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, etc.), or equivalent.
3+ years of experience in data and reporting-related roles in an insurance or financial industry setting
Demonstrates success working with data discovery, analytics, visualization, and business intelligence tools such as SSRS, PowerBI, BusinessObjects, etc.

Basic level proficiency with query performance tuning

None

Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
This is a cross-functional process SME leadership role with responsibility for project management, business readiness, initiative prioritization, as well as the overall change management. The project portfolio includes projects with moderate to high complexity and impact across multiple business units and functions. This position will interact with other groups in the organization such as the functional business teams and the IT capability lanes. This individual must be self-directed and work well within a team environment and be a process SME in the function supported. They will be part innovator, part problem solver and will bring subject matter expertise to their area of focus.
This person will report to the Senior Manager in Milwaukee, but can be located at the posted locations.
Functional/Subject Matter Expert – You will bring expertise from the global supply chain functional domains to support the strategy team in implementing Enterprise and ISC initiatives. Understanding the processes with an end-to-end perspective and a level of domain expertise, to allow insight to the business impact of not only their process area, but also upstream and downstream processes. Able to provide direction for functional users within and outside the Integrated Supply Chain.
Technical Enablement – The Business Process Analyst (BPA) collaborates with IT teams and product owners to implement and manage technology that supports the Integrated Supply Chain. They participate in system implementations by defining requirements, supporting testing and validations as well as business readiness.
Communication/Stakeholder Management – The BPA will assemble process deliverables, presentations, and communicate to all levels within and outside of the ISC organization. They collaborate with Product Owners and IT teams to leverage technology to streamline and optimize global business processes and participate in system implementation projects. Engages and collaborates with stakeholders across different functions and regions to understand their requirements, address concerns, and align process initiatives with business objectives.
Project complexity – This individual is responsible for structuring and executing projects and process improvement initiatives that cross the ISC functional areas.
Change Management/Business Readiness - The BPA leads change management efforts related to process improvements and system implementations within their process area and aligned with the enterprise roadmap. They develop change management documentation, facilitate training, and communicate process changes to stakeholders and subject matter experts.
Leadership – This individual is motivated to be a thought leader in the Global Supply Chain organization. They will demonstrate the ability to put new innovations to work in a practical way as well as have interest and a passion to mentor other members of the Rockwell Automation organization.
The Essentials - You Will Have:
Bachelor’s degree
Legal authorization to work is required. We will not offer sponsorship for this position now or in the future for this job opening.

Knowledge of SAP, MRP, inventory, or production planning principles.
Proven leadership and change management skills to drive improvements across the broader supply chain organization and influence stakeholders across the regions and functions.
Experience in an agile environment.
Project Management Certification, Lean/Six Sigma, CPM, APIC Certification
Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of the different audiences. Listens attentively and keeps others well informed. Opportunity

The Kohler Information Technology (IT) organization is an enterprise staff function responsible for Information Technology across the global organization. IT is committed to delivering against Kohler Co.’s increasingly digital agenda by enabling strategic outcomes. Within the organization, there are multiple teams who work together to achieve business value – Business Partners, Infrastructure and Operations, Core Capabilities, Digital Capabilities, Enterprise Architecture and Cybersecurity. This position is part of the Digital Capabilities organization and works with our business partners and cross-functionally within IT to deliver business value through project implementations.

The Business Analyst works with IT project teams and business clients to collect, clarify, and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design to develop digital applications and solutions. The ideal candidate can recommend changes to existing applications, identify impacted interfaces, and work with the technical team to implement and test the changes.

The role involves working with Kohler Co. at a global level and across multiple time zones with a wide variety of key working relationships in areas such as USA, China, Europe, and India.

Specific Responsibilities

The Business Analyst must have demonstrated expertise in digital and/or ecommerce projects to include:

Work with business and technical partners to elicit, analyze, and document business requirements; understand the customer journey and define system requirements.

Negotiate system solutions that satisfy requirements and deliver business value while ensuring consistency with architectural guidelines and security standards.
Work with multiple stakeholders to assess the impact of proposed solutions, facilitate deployments and minimize disruption to services.

Promote architectural consistency and standards.
Review test cases to ensure requirements are fully covered.

Bachelor's degree is required, with preference in Information Technology / Information Systems areas.
5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or performing business analysis activities.
2-4 years of experience in digital/ecommerce platforms
Knowledge and experience in Agile development framework
Demonstrate strong communication skills both verbal and written.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Position Summary

At PPi, we strive to create innovative software solutions that improve our clients' businesses. As a Business Analyst, you will play a key role in helping us achieve this goal. You will work closely with our development team to gather and analyze business requirements. You will then identify opportunities for improvement and translate these insights into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about technology and have strong analytical skills, we encourage you to apply.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

Gather and analyze business requirements.
Develop use cases and user stories.
Work with stakeholders to define project scope and objectives.
Collaborate with Development, Application Support, Information Technology, and Client Success teams to design, create, and deliver solutions.
Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses.
Identify and recommend process improvements.
Develop test plans and participate in quality assurance testing.
Perform consultative Client support for the use and/or configuration of our product, Care Compass.
Understand Client business needs, workflows, and administrative systems to support and/or improve Client’s quality and administrative functions.

Required Skills and Abilities

Bachelor's degree in business administration, computer science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience as a business analyst working with software development teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong interpersonal, collaborative, and relationship-building skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Excel and Visio.
Experience with requirements documentation tools, such as Jira or Confluence.
Solid experience in writing SQL queries.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience working with healthcare systems, particularly insurance plans and claims processing, or in a similarly regulated environment is a plus.

Work Environment

General office (or remote office) environment.

HOW YOU WILL DO IT
Purpose Statement: Business Analysts provide Customer Service Excellence by helping customers implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way, determining the requirements of a project or program, communicating them clearly to stakeholders and solutions development, and helping end users test and deploy the solutions.

Technical Currency: Remain current on Plexus business, industry and IT technology trends in order to provide forward looking solutions
Focus on continuous improvement - personal, the team, and processes. Develop, discuss and adapt to those enhancements and changes.
Actively participate in and sometimes lead Functional User Groups and similar meetings by sharing common problems and solutions across multiple sites/regions and providing user request updates.
Additional duties as assigned.

2-5 years of related experience is required.
CCBA certification achieved or expected within role
Agile and Lean Six Sigma certifications are desirable

Experience in computing systems or IT support is highly desirable
An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key job accountabilities may be considered.

Action oriented

Hoffmaster Group Inc, is an industry leader producing the most complete line of specialty disposable tabletop products for over 75 years. This is not a remote postion

Primary Purpose of the Role

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and visualizing data to help Hoffmaster make data-driven decisions. You will work with various data sources, tools, and technologies to provide insights that support strategic planning and operational improvements.

Essential job Duties

Collect, clean, and integrate data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and external data providers, to create a unified dataset for analysis.
Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Use statistical and data mining techniques to uncover insights.
Create clear and concise reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to communicate findings and insights to stakeholders.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support decision-making, strategy development, and process improvements.
Develop and implement predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data validation and data quality processes.
Assist in establishing data governance practices, data standards, and best practices within the organization.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses and research to address specific business questions or challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, business units, and management, to understand their data needs and deliver solutions.
Required Skills and Abilities

Strong understanding and experience working with relational databases, especially in Microsoft SQL Server
Experience with Microsoft Azure
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL technologies (T-SQL, SSIS, SSAS) and data warehouse design theory (Kimball data modeling/Inmom)
Experience building solutions in Power BI
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective oral and written communication skills
Ability to balance multiple projects
Detail oriented and organized
Self-motivated
Ability to work independently or as a member of a team of technical professionals
Minimum of an associate degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or other related technical discipline
Minimum of two years developing business intelligence solutions

Description

Basic Function

The Sales Analyst provides analytical, operational, and administrative support to Sales and Marketing teams in the North American region (“NAM”), focusing on the operational interface between Procelys and our support function partners to ensure the high-quality delivery of products and services to our customers.

Supervisor

The Sales Analyst reports to the Procelys Sales Director- NAM

Tasks & Duties

Organize and help guide our internal service partners (Supply Chain, Customer Service, Quality, Production Planning, Demand Planning, Manufacturing/Industrial group) to deliver great customer service

Data management – the primary function will be operating, updating, analyzing and maintaining comprehensive spreadsheets that contains customer and product data from SAP (ERP), C4C (CRM system by SAP) and other Excel-based sources
Represent the Procelys sales organization in operations meetings and monitor that orders are served on-time and in-full, contribute to resolving issues, and alert the Sales Director or Sales Managers when needed
Participate in other meetings with internal functions such as customer service, demand planning, quality, production planning, and supply chain as appropriate
Organize, measure, and disseminate key performance indicators for the department

Support the Sales Director and sales team

Prepare reports, proposals, presentations, and other documents as instructed
Participate in meetings, events, conferences, and exhibitions in the region
Help resolve operational issues and customer complaints where necessary, maintain action logs (unpaid invoices, open claims, responses to questionnaires), and work with the sales team and stakeholders to complete action tickets that are maintained in C4C
Help enter customer data into key data management systems as needed
Support our distribution partners as a channel to Procelys systems (e.g., sample requests entered into CRM)
Become our super-user in the C4C CRM system and provide first-level technical support
Support the Sales team to ensure the following are captured and maintained in our information systems (ERP, CRM): customer profiles and updates; negotiated prices & conditions; credit notes and commission statements; sample requests; quality complaints; questionnaire requests; and other activities as needed
The position requires occasional (<20%) travel to meetings, events, and conferences in both the NAM region and occasionally to international sites (mostly France)
The territory is North America, which includes the US, Canada, and Mexico

Education & experience:

The Sales Analyst will hold a bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in general business administration or related field. International commerce and a 3-5-year experience in a similar function ideally in a B2B environment is desired.
Experience creating, editing, managing, and analyzing pivot tables in Excel, as well as operational knowledge of SAP (or similar ERP systems) is required.

Skills & Competencies:

Customer-oriented attitude - good listening skills, professionalism, attention to details, willingness to take ownership of problems, communications with many parties and partners to solve problems
Strong computer skills, particularly on software such as Excel (dynamic pivot tables), SAP, CRM (preferably C4C), Microsoft Office 365 (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook).
Team player: able to build strong relationship with internal and external stakeholders such as Supply Chain, Customer Service, Quality, Production Planning, Demand Planning, Manufacturing/Industrial group, Finance, and the Procelys NAM sales and marketing teams.
Knowledge in International commercial trade topics such as contracts, Incoterms, import - export procedures, legal and financial obligations
Dependability: follow instructions, respond to management direction; take responsibility for own actions; keep commitments; complete tasks on time or notify appropriate person of delays
Self-starter, autonomous, & motivated
Good communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to understand instructions and customer needs, and to communicate clearly within the organization
Ability to maintain confidentiality, when necessary
Experience producing accurate and professional documents, proposals, and reports

English required; French and/or Spanish are beneficial

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Compensation package:

Bonus opportunities

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Milwaukee, WI: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

B2B: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

Sartori, a fourth-generation owned company, has proudly produced internationally award- winning, artisan cheese for customers globally since 1939. Rooted in Plymouth, WI and a plant in Antigo, WI. Sartori's emphasis on high quality and hand-crafted approach to cheese making is a timeless family tradition.
When you come to work at Sartori, you don't just join a Company, you join a family - one great team devoted to making the best cheese in the world. To attract and retain the best people, we offer a rewarding culture and industry-leading benefits for our Team Members.

Comprehensive low-cost insurance
Profit Sharing and 401K
PTO
A dedication to the growth and development of our team members
Uniform and Boot Reimbursement
Tuition Reimbursement
Onsite Fitness Facility
Family Events
Fruit and Produce Delivery
Paid Maternity/Paternity Leave and more!

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Maintains, designs, implements, and administers Sartori Company’s instance of JDE and related business systems.
Provides application support, troubleshooting and training to the end user community. Applications include, but are not limited to, JDEdwards, Hubble and Cloud Inventory.
Manages and participates in project teams to achieve project goals within budget and project timelines.
Collaborates with business resources to define and document business requirements, gains consensus on solution(s) and implements technology solutions that are aligned with corporate and/or departmental objectives.
Manages business system development lifecycle and other documentation needs for long-term reference and support.
Proactively manages changes in project scope, identifies potential issues, and creates contingency plans to ensure objectives are met.
Conducts project postmortems and recommends future improvements focused on people, processes, and technology.
Ensures adequate testing and debugging of applications and processes before implementation.
Collaborates with external software support to find solutions.
Manages the work of outsourced analysts and programmers.
Performs application configuration.
Seeks opportunities to re-engineer business processes by anticipating future end user and company Business System needs.
Stays abreast of and incorporates technological advancements consistent with the company's strategic objectives.
Participate in the Business Systems team’s “on-call” rotation to support the business during and outside normal business hours.
Will do minor travel to support project implementation when needed.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s Degree required.
5(+) years of Business Systems Analyst experience implementing technology solutions in an ERP environment.
Experience with JD Edwards EnterpriseOne Order-to-Cash, Record-to-Report, Logistics/Warehouse Management processes preferred.

OTHER KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Thorough knowledge of developing solutions and analytical skills using JD Edwards (preferred) or another major ERP system.
Advanced interviewing, listening, and observational skills used to identify and define business and technical needs.
Leadership, project/process management, quality commitment and relationship management skills.
Ability to program in any of the following is a plus: JDEdwards, MS SQL Server stored procedures and queries, Microsoft Analysis, Microsoft Reporting Services, SharePoint, and Cloud Inventory.
To be goal-oriented through demonstrated ability to bring the benefits of technology to solve business issues while also managing costs and risk.
Ability to be collaborative and personable through communication and understanding the needs of non-technical internal clients.
Ability to manage and deliver multiple development projects on time and within budget.
Ability to mesh well across all business units by being a good listener, a team builder and an articulate advocate of their business information and technology needs.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

All experience levels will be considered with the job title adjusted accordingly. Serve as a Business Analyst within a large agile project. The emphasis of this team will be to implement a new suite of insurance software to lay the groundwork for future growth. Specifically, this position will be focused on identifying and documenting the business requirements and ensure the voice of the customer is heard throughout the implementation.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Ability to understand requirements across teams

Identify and define process improvements to business workflows
Identify risks or impediments during sprints and raise up those concerns to leadership
Partner with quality analyst and automation testers to assist in preparing test plans, test scenarios, and test cases
Partner with the quality analyst and automation testers to verify testing criteria aligns with the business’s processes

WHO WE ARE
We’re a global team of over 25,000 engineering, manufacturing, supply chain and sustaining service experts who partner with customers to bring their products to life through inspired innovation and world-class customer service.
From surgical devices and health monitors to warehouse robotics and space products, we partner with our customers to help create the products that build a better world.
Whether you’re looking to start, make a change or advance your career, find your path at Plexus Corp. and make an impact.
WHY WE LOVE IT
Engaging and challenging projects that fulfill and develop you. People that inspire and empower you to realize your full potential. Leadership and development programs to support your career goals.

We believe that our people create our best Plexus. At Plexus, we value the ideas generated by our collective uniqueness and recognize that the diverse backgrounds, life experiences and perspectives of our team members enable us to create the innovative products that build a better world. Because of this, we encourage people of all backgrounds to apply to our positions, and will look at candidates holistically, balancing work, education and additional experiences.
HOW YOU WILL DO IT
Purpose Statement: The Financial Analyst – Business Partner provides financial leadership to the Customer Focus Teams (“CFT”s) at our manufacturing sites. They influence decisions made by the CFT to ensure that customer satisfaction is balanced with profitable revenue for each customer program. They are responsible for a variety of financial activities, which ensure we deliver accurate financial results from our operations and while monitoring our financial performance and working to continuously improve it.
Key Job Accountabilities:
Serve as the key Business Partner representing financial inputs to the CFT. Lead discussions with and challenge functional departments and the CFT in order to construct financial forecasts that are consistent and predictable.
Lead the customer’s financial month-end close process; work with corporate accounting, site management and supporting teams to ensure site- and customer-level financial results are correctly stated in accordance with corporate procedures.
Proactively manage customer financial results by influencing operational decisions on our customers which maximize our performance; includes performing and presenting margin and cost recovery analysis to the CFT team.
Lead monthly customer sales and margin forecast process. Prepare accurate monthly customer sales forecasts, and weekly updates.
Lead the customer re-pricing process using the Impact ECS quote tool and ensure pricing models are properly implemented and executed. Analyze new pricing impact through Pro-Forma P&L review to ensure it meets site and market sector financial targets when establishing new pricing.
Focus’ on a broad range of MPFs including customers with multiple MPFs and complex assembly portfolios. MPFs will have a significant financial impact within the site and the portfolio of customers may be diverse.
Analyzes processes and procedures for effectiveness and engages with peers to establish improvements in both communication and analysis of results or forecasted performance.
Uses business insight and financial acumen to make judgements about appropriate direction of the business based on actual and forecasted results.
Additional Accountabilities:
Follow up on pricing and re-pricing activities by providing analysis of quoted business and actual financial results to ensure we meet our financial targets. Review results of analysis with the customer focus team to drive improvement in direct labor, indirect labor and material pricing.
Lead risk mitigation and cost recovery initiatives for the customer, and help ensure pricing models are managed appropriately. Drive closure of claims, including: PPV, NRE, carrying cost, labor/fixed cost recoveries and E&O.
To assure accurate repricing of assemblies, possess a thorough understanding of customer contracts and pricing models for assigned customers. Provide P&L and margin analysis to determine repricing targets
Execute unique pricing projects including production/prototype assemblies
Execute forecast processes including validating NREs, pricing, assembly quantities, variances and margins to ensure an accurate forecast. Lead the Customer Focus Team forecast meetings to determine the appropriate forecast
Perform analysis using historical data, contractual expectations and invoice timing to provide the customers AP and AR forecast. Review deposit and inventory forecasts and follow up with the CFT team to make sure they align to the broader forecast.
Work with customer focus team to determine risk and opportunity for each forecast cycle.
Drive communication of financials to Operations team and gather data from Operations
Ensure key balance sheet and P&L accounts are properly stated; provide leadership on issues by coordinating with Cost Accounting and Financial support teams to determine appropriate resolution.
Provide financial analysis by reviewing trial balance and other financial statements to ensure accuracy.
Research and track Accounts Receivable issues including past due invoices and open debit memos; drive closure to improve customer cash cycle and prevent reserve adjustments for bad debt and CRGs.
Drive disposition of customer financial transactions through the financial support and centralized teams to ensure accurate and timely reporting are maintained
Attend Materials Readiness Board (MRB) and maintain TipQA to ensure assumptions around NCM parts responsibility are documented and appropriate disposition decisions are being made (Plexus not taking unnecessary cOP hits).
Review NCM and E&O to aid the CFT and customer management in creating recovery plans
Work with Program Managers, Accounting and any additional department (as needed) to correct shipment mistakes or valuation errors.
Review new business with existing customers to assess financial performance.
Analysis of customer transactions and inventory to manage need for customer credits.
Lead CFT financial reviews to identify underperforming assemblies or programs. Drive results and improvement initiatives to support improved profitability.
Additional duties as assigned.
Education/Experience Qualifications:
A minimum of a(n) Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration is required; a(n) Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics is preferred
1 years of related experience is required; 2 years of related experience is preferred
An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key job accountabilities may be considered.

Other Qualifications:
Proficiency in Excel is required.
Experience with or expertise in financial systems is strongly preferred.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.
Excellent leadership, communication, collaboration and teamwork skills are essential.
Data storytelling and converting data into insights are strongly preferred.
Physical Requirements:
None
Work Environment:
The work setting should consist of an office environment with suitable lighting, comfortable temperatures, and a low noise level.

Job Description:

The Department of Natural Resources Information Technology (DNR IT) executive program is seeking applicants for a Business Analyst position to support the Division of Environmental Management, Bureau of Remediation and Redevelopment.
This work requires 40 hrs./week work for a candidate with advanced skill sets and experience.

The most qualified candidate will have:

Knowledge and direct experience working as an analyst in collaboration with IT professionals, such as developers and business experts to create requirements and develop technical specifications for use in developing custom applications.
Proficiency in business analysis methodologies and best practices related to business needs, investigative techniques, workflows, use cases, user stories, comparison analysis, time and cost estimates, data analysis tools and techniques.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, such as SQL (Structured Query Language), Excel, data visualization tools and statistical analysis software
Proficiency in requirements management tools like Confluence or DevOps to capture, document, track, and manage requirements throughout a project lifecycle.
Understanding of Iterative/Agile/Scrum Methodologies and Agile project management tools such as DevOps
Working knowledge of programing languages such as .NET, Java and/or Powerscript
Knowledge of system analysis techniques, such as UML (Unified Modeling Language), to effectively analyze and document system requirements, use cases, and workflows.
Programming knowledge such as R or Python to perform data analysis.
Proficiency in using various business intelligence tools for creating reports and dashboards.
Understanding and experience with Oracle databases
Experience utilizing the Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and following IT Best Practices
Experience writing documentation that is clear and concise that is understood by technical and non-technical staff.
Analytical and critical thinking skills to understand and prioritize business requirements.
The ability to communicate concisely with the stakeholders and clients with regard to the requirements.
The ability to collaborate with others and be a team player.
The ability to be adaptable.
Highly analytical and self-motivating with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities.

Additional skill sets that will also be helpful:

Experience with SharePoint.
Experience working with legacy applications.
Experience working in Government.

This position will work at the direction of the DNR IT Supervisor and Business Relationship Manager utilizing DNR IT standards, software, and tools. Tasks of this position include, but are not limited to:

Orienting self to current application(s) by working with others Document all current application processes Analyze business requirements and processes with the help of data analytics to provide innovative solutions Create solutions based on the requirements identified and work towards achieving the program’s long-term goals. Identify issues and opportunities with solutions to improve processes Gain an understanding of regulatory and reporting requirements Communicate with the relevant stakeholders and transfer knowledge to the project development team

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift
