We are seeking a talented and self-motivated individual to join our team as a Fixed Income Capital Markets Business Analyst. This individual will be involved in both recurring and project based duties that span Finance, Operations, Compliance and Legal, Marketing and PR, Business Development and Client Services. The ideal candidate will have a strategic viewpoint and self-motivation to tackle multiple tasks at once.

As a Business Analyst, you may:

1. Analyze business trends, metrics, and results for the Fixed Income Sales & Trading and Public Finance businesses.

2. Prepares executive level presentations, receiving guidance from the leadership team.

3. Complete research on potential recruiting opportunities and prepares financial models. Analyze profitability by product line.

4. Perform month end reconciliations, prepares commission reports and payout summaries.

5. Provide ongoing support to the Sales & Trading team members with commissions and P&L variance issues and questions.

6. Assist in building and tracking the budget and managing expectations for many teams within the department.

7. Work closely with members of Baird’s Finance and Operations teams and other internal clients to ensure efficient operations.

8. Become the relationship contact between local office and Baird Real Estate (CREW) team for any and all real estate changes (i.e., new offices, expiring leases, etc.)

9. In collaboration with FICM Accounting Coordinator, ensure timely and accuracy in processing invoices, expense reports, receivables and performs deal reconciliations. Prepare deal summaries.

10. Business Continuity (BC) plan owner working directly with the BC team on a quarterly basis to maintain plan documents and provide appropriate testing along with communication during live ‘disasters’.

11. Tracks vendor spend, reports on it by product group

What makes this opportunity great:

1. Compelling careers working side-by-side with the best in the business.

2. Team of associates passionate about achieving great results for clients and giving back to the communities where we live and work.

3. Unique culture that values diverse backgrounds and perspectives while emphasizing teamwork and a strong sense of partnership.


What we look for:


1. Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting.

2. 3-5 years of experience.

3. Advanced computer skills including Excel, Word, Power Point and Outlook.
4. Must obtain FINRA licenses SIE, 7, 50, 52, 63 within 2 years of start date and FINRA 24, 53, 54 within 4 years of start date.

5. Natural curiosity, self-driven motivation to learn and interest in the Fixed Income markets required.

6. Strong interpersonal communication skills, both oral and written. A high level of professionalism is mandatory.

7. Excellent grammar, editing and proofing skills required. Attention to detail and positive can-do attitude a must.

8. Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously, often under pressure and/or short deadlines.

9. Willingness and ability to work additional hours as needed to ensure work is completed in a timely fashion.

10. Ability to tolerate peak workloads, multiple assignments and produce results with accuracy and reliability.

11. Demonstrates a calm demeanor and retains composure in stressful situations.

12. Ability to initiate action and work independently on most tasks.

13. Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism with sensitive project information.

Company Description


About Veolia North America:

A subsidiary of Veolia Group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has approximately 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com.



Job Description


Benefits:

Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

Position Purpose:

In this role, the HRIS Analyst is responsible for providing support to various HR Systems including troubleshooting system defects, administration, configuration, reporting, testing, and new developments/releases. This role supports the development of systems specifications, design and development from the end user perspective.

Primary Duties / Responsibilities:

Documents and analyzes requirements (e.g., business system, security, conversion, and report), develop detailed data, functional design, and document specifications, and assist with conversion, testing, training, and other project needs throughout the development life cycle.
Designs, refreshes, and implements the configuration and QA process to support HR system solutions, configuration, and processes.
Assists with system conversions and upgrades to include data conversion, data mapping, data analysis, integration of business process best practices, coordination of temporary consulting resources assisting with implementation initiative.
Maintains, analyzes, and supports reports of varying complexities utilizing appropriate reporting tools.
Performs analysis into the root cause of problems and recommends solutions for HR systems.
Assists in development and implementation of and maintains audit and testing procedures to ensure accuracy and integrity of HR system data.
Identifies process improvement/automation opportunities and participates in initiatives: develop, document, implement, support/maintain.
Provides long-term maintenance, support, and management of HR Systems. Leverage both industry and system best practices when partnering with the business lead and partners in the configuration of the platform.
Perform other job-related duties as required, including cross-training and supporting various HRIS applications, processes, and reporting. Assist with special projects as required.

Work Environment:

This is a hybrid position
Position can be based in either Milwaukee, WI or Paramus, NJ
Occasional travel as needed.


Qualifications


Knowledge / Skills / Abilities:

Organizational, project management and analytical skills to support HR systems and projects.
Working knowledge of human resources functions, processes, and database structure: system setup, inter-dependencies, and data flow to track down problems.
Technical problem-solving capabilities with ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users/customers.
Computer skills with thorough technical aptitude and attention to details; proficiency in Microsoft Office or Google Workspace; understanding of HR/payroll systems and processing and related interfaces.
Knowledge of report writing applications to be able to run and troubleshoot report discrepancies.
Ability to balance day-to-day tasks/projects/enhancement initiatives and embrace fast-paced organizational change.
Experience with working with multiple third-party vendors.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects and produce project deliverables according to established deadlines. Required.
Ability to adapt and adjust to change, quick learner with technology aptitude, and excellent customer service attitude.
Detail-oriented to evaluate and ensure the accuracy of data with sense of urgency to meet deadlines required.

Education / Experience / Background:

A bachelor's degree and minimum 3-5 years’ technical experience with various HR processes and disciplines (Recruiting, Benefits, Payroll, Leaves of Absence); or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience with payroll and timekeeping system configuration strongly preferred.
Experience with HRIS system implementation a plus.

Additional Information

Job Description:
Are you passionate about creating efficiencies and finding ways to streamline processes? Do you like learning about various areas of Operations and working with different teams? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Global Operations Continuous Improvement Team!

As a Senior Operations Business Analyst, you'll work cross-functionally to identify areas for improvement in our operations and develop innovative solutions to increase speed, quality, teamwork, and cost-effectiveness. This is a hands-on role where you'll get to spearhead Kaizen events, conduct time studies, implement lean practices, and test new process flows, just to name a few.

We're looking for someone who geeks out on metrics, loves root cause analysis, and has a keen eye for spotting waste and inefficiency. You should be great at gathering data, structuring projects, solving problems, and socializing the positive progress that is being made.

The ideal candidate will have strong analytical abilities, experience facilitating projects, and superb communication skills to drive change management. This is a versatile position with lots of growth opportunities as you'll interact daily with leadership and teams across Promega Operations. An engineering, operations, business, or analytics background is preferred.

Our continuous improvement team prides itself on having an impact on core business functions. You'll be empowered to make substantive improvements that directly benefit our internal team and our external customers.

CORE DUTIES:

1. Analyze global operations to assess, identify, and implement process improvement opportunities including standardization of best practices.

2. Design, develop, test, and/or evaluate integrated systems for managing production processes including production flow and throughput, human factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, and cost analysis.

3. Discover, create and support the management and implementation of continuous improvement lean tools, methodologies, and training. Act as a coach and mentor, where applicable.

4. Project Management – initiate and coordinate intradepartmental and cross-departmental projects, as necessary. Lead or support projects and complete project objectives in a timely and efficient manner.

5. Perform departmental reporting and apply statistical methods in the identification and development of metrics, KPI’s, and measurement systems for global and local applications.

6. Ensure product quality – work cross functionally to implement designs and process improvements. Investigate customer complaints and implement corrective actions to prevent future occurrence of chronic or severe quality problems. Ensure compliance to ISO and Quality System Requirements.

As a Business Analyst and Project Manager, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business objectives and technology solutions by analyzing and documenting business requirements, managing projects, and ensuring successful project delivery. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, clients, vendors, and leadership to analyze business processes, gather requirements, and manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables. This position requires a strong understanding of business analysis methodologies, project management principles, and excellent communication skills.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Business Analysis:

Conduct comprehensive business process analysis to identify areas for improvement, efficiency gains, and cost reduction opportunities.
Business process mapping (lean manufacturing)
Collaborate with clients and the SSR team to elicit, document, and analyze business requirements, ensuring alignment with project goals and objectives.
Perform gap analysis to identify discrepancies between current and desired business processes and systems.
Create detailed business requirements, use cases, process flow diagrams, and other relevant documentation.
Collaborate with technical teams to translate business requirements into functional specifications.

Project Management:

Lead, create, organize, and manage all aspects of assigned projects, including defining project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
Develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocation strategies to ensure successful project execution.
Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to keep projects on track.
Coordinate and facilitate project meetings, including requirement gathering sessions, status updates, and project reviews.
Manage project budgets, track expenditures, and ensure projects are completed within allocated resources.
Collaborate with the clients and the SSR team members to ensure effective communication and alignment throughout the project lifecycle.

Documentation and Reporting:

Create and maintain project documentation.
Generate regular reports on project progress, status, and key performance indicators.

Conduct post-project evaluations to identify lessons learned and areas for improvement.

Requirements:
Must reside locally to Milwaukee/Brookfield-This is NOT a remote position
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst and Project Manager, in the technical application field.
Must be comfortable with driving change.
Strong knowledge of business analysis methodologies, tools, and techniques.
Solid understanding of project management principles and practices.
Experience in one or more of the following preferred, not required: IT Services, Manufacturing, Real estate, health care, ERP or CRM systems.
Must be organized while managing multiple engagements.
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.
Exceptional communication, interpersonal and critical & problem-solving skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with all levels of leadership.
Must be able to execute project plans while holding the team accountable and managing a budget.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks.
Work effectively under minimal supervision with strong time-management skills.
Thrives on collaborating well with clients and provides an exceptional client experience.
Able to work in a fast-paced IT environment.

Nice to Haves:

Manufacturing and ERP experience
Custom Development experience

Overview:
The position is on-site at our Stevens Point, Wisconsin facility. The schedule is Monday through Friday from 8:00am to 5:00pm - this is not a remote opportunity.

Responsible for providing analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions through Power BI. Will provide capabilities to solve business problems by providing dashboards and/or data solutions to assist business units in monitoring performance metrics/insights. Maintain the Power BI data model and adjust the data model for new reporting needs. Also, the successful candidate will provide training and leadership to Data Analyst.

What to Expect:


Responsible for providing data and metrics (including dashboards) in Power BI to the business units as requested
Managing the Power BI data model, modifying the data model to accommodate new reporting requirements and investigating data issues with Power BI reporting
Writing specs for new/revision to existing reports; documentation and testing prior to release to the business units
Analyzing large amounts of data and report on trends/forecasts, assist with the design, development, and maintenance of the Analytic Datamarts including quality checks, identifying issues and working with partners to create solutions
Continually work with the user to collect reporting requirements, establish appropriate test criteria and work with manager to develop a solution if one does not exist
Identify problem areas in the organization and develop a data solution through process improvement
Create Key Performance Indicators for departments, develops advanced analytics solutions, test and design of historical and predictive analytics solutions to solve business problems

What You Will Contribute:


Bachelor’s degree or 3 to 4 years Data Analyst experience preferred in a related field.
Advanced experience using Microsoft Excel, SQL, Data Warehouse with a strong understanding of Power BI and or dashboarding tools.
Demonstrated knowledge of how to create/improve business processes with ability to understand/perform business and functional requirement analysis
Strong ability to write Excel formulas, apply statistical/analytical mathematical concepts to solve problems.
Experience with Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization software, SQL, DataMarts and ability to process data via PowerQuery and PowerAutomate
CHARACTER QUALITIES: Thoroughness, Dependability, Orderliness, Persistence, Responsibility and Wisdom.

Competitive compensation with bonus program.

Opportunities for growth and development such as company university and tuition reimbursement options.

Health and wellness initiatives: walking challenge, weight loss challenge, health risk assessment and more!

Why Work at Ortho Molecular Products:

Simply put, our healthcare system is broken. It is expensive, complicated, and dysfunctional. At Ortho Molecular Products, our vision is to transform the practice of medicine. Every day, across America and the world, we help health care providers implement better solutions for health challenges that include lifestyle medicine and nutritional therapies proven to improve patient outcomes. We do this by manufacturing science-based products and developing innovative clinical programs for doctors that help their patients get better faster.

We are looking for people who align with our mission and want to invest their lifework and passion into transforming the practice of medicine. Our team is purpose-driven, values-based, and service-focused. We are looking for likeminded people who want to join the movement that is changing the way healthcare is being delivered.

DLF USA Inc. North America SBU is currently recruiting for a HRIS & Operations Analyst.

DLF Group is the world leader in the development and sale of high-quality grass seeds for the agricultural and professional lawn market. By continuously developing new innovative varieties and products, and with a strong focus on quality and reliability, DLF Group offers demonstrable value to the business of their customers and other relationships.

DLF North America SBU, is one of our four Strategic Business Units. DLF employees are characterized by a high level of competency, passion, and commitment. Together with an entrepreneurial mindset and a flat organization, this contributes to DLF’s unique agility.

We turn science into growth! Come grow with DLF! Get on our grass!

Check us out at www.dlf.com (corporate site choose Canada & U.S.A.).

About the role

The HRIS & Operations Analyst will manage the day-to-day SuccessFactors (SSF) HR HCM modules, support the execution of annual activities, and provide configuration and testing assistance related to SSF HR enhancements and implementations. The role will focus on the execution of HR system administration activities, including processing activities, reviewing existing system configuration settings such as notifications and leveraging reports. The incumbent will have the opportunity to work with other teams within and outside of our Global HR to support HR systems and process enhancement projects.

The ideal work model is hybrid home and our office in Lacrosse, Wisconsin.

Key responsibilities:

· Address HRIS system-related questions through troubleshooting, configuration and design of business processes, workflow, security, and report modifications

· Effectively collaborate with teams such as HR, Talent, Recruiting, Technology, Finance, and others to provide support for requests such as enhancements, defects, and new functionality

· Conduct needs assessment, performs GAP analysis on SuccessFactors, leads business process modeling and helps the business develop “to-be” business processes

· Engage external vendors to troubleshoot configuration requirements, as needed

· Support the Global HR team with annual cycle system administration tasks Examples: Employee Engagement Surveys, Performance Reviews, Compensation process, Learning Management Systems

· Own the SharePoint site about the HRIS - SSF/People System

· Conduct regular analysis to ensure data accuracy, including the use of Excel functions such as VLOOKUP, leveraging reports for data reconciliation efforts and random spot-checks of HR data

· Document and maintain HRIS and business user guides

· Provide training and support for HRIS

· Look for efficiency gains in our processes and partner with team members to prioritize

· Provide support for the input of daily transactions into our HR systems as required

· Develop, create, and maintain a variety of reports

Qualifications for the ideal candidate:

· Post-secondary degree or diploma from an accredited college or university in Information Technology

· Post-secondary degree or diploma from an accredited college or university in Human Resources Management

· Minimum 3 years SAP SuccessFactors HRIS/HCM systems functional experience, or combination of education and experience

· Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, particularly MS Excel, including advanced formulas, Pivot Tables, exports/imports, etc.

· ⁠Familiarity with human resources policies and procedures to ensure the HRIS meets organizational needs and goals & strong business aptitude for HR systems functionality

· Self-managing and results-oriented

· Excellent organizational skills

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

· ⁠Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to train and explain concepts and technologies to all levels of the organization

· ⁠Impeccable attention to detail to help maintain our HR architecture, processes, security, and data integrity

· ⁠Ability to work well in structured and unstructured environments, under pressure, and with changing and competing priorities and timelines

· Works well with small teams to take responsibility for and lead projects from start to finish

· 10% travel International (Canada, USA, Europe)

Compensation and Benefits:

This position comes with a competitive compensation plan that includes a base salary, competitive benefit & retirement plans and many other perks. Compensation will be based on experience.

If you meet the above qualifications and are interested in joining our DLF team, please send your resume and cover letter highlighting your talent and why you fit this role to karen.baird@dlf.com or apply on Indeed.

At E15, we are the spark that ignites. The Business Data Analyst is a senior analyst position on the E15 analytics team within Levy. As a Business Data Analyst, you would become E15’s primary point of contact with Levy's operators and clients at Fiserv Forum with the Milwaukee Bucks. Performing quarterly & annual partner reviews

Observe food and beverage operations on gamedays to better understand bottlenecks, points of friction, and identify further areas of opportunity through contextualizing the data.

SQL

Data visualization (Tableau strongly preferred)

Can share examples of how they have used creativity to achieve excellent outcomes

Job Title: Business Support Analyst (New Product Introduction) Job
Job Description:
New Product Introduction Specialist


Reporting to: R&D Director North America – Durable Goods

This Role is located in Wauwatosa, WI (remote option available)


The New Product Introduction (NPI) Specialist for the Durable Goods Business Unit at Bostik will work collaboratively across the business to efficiently setup new private label and converted products for production. The specialist will ensure the new product setup complies with Corporate processes and has input into continuous improvement initiatives to enable efficient use of processes for related projects.




Job dimensions

Facilitate launch of new private label and converted products within Durable Goods Business Unit
Serve as the single point of contact for information gathering to improve efficiency of setup of private label products
Articulate a big picture process or goal to a diverse group of stakeholders in a way to garner productive input, support, and active participation
Monitor SAP setup and associated workflows; route requests for approval and translate data into the various systems required for completion
Engage in project management/stagegate process for private label products; maintain core team meetings and assist in preparation of gate documents
Work with management team to prioritize NPI projects; maintain status list


Activities

Review private label or converted product BOMs with initiators for consistency prior to submittal
Shepherd item number data requests through system setup; maintain list of approvers for each function at relevant plants
Engage with appropriate approvers to improve efficiency of new product setup of private label and converted products
Work with Product Line Managers, Product Safety and Regulatory Affairs, Supply Chain, and directly with customers to review customer-specific labeling requirements; manage workflow for creating private labels
Maintain documented workflows for private label sealants, private label tapes, imported purchased finished goods, and converted products.
Assist in information gathering to aid customers in SDS and TDS generation


Reporting:

Provide regular reports on status, current prioritization, and time to completion of requests


Accountabilities

Support customers through private label setup of new products
Work in cross-functional teams (business, sales, supply chain, manufacturing, research & development, PLM, …) to advocate and execute the private label strategy related to adhesives, sealants, and converted products within the Durable Goods business unit
Aptitude to connect and organize a variety of tasks into a detailed, efficient, and streamlined plan and then shepherd it to completion


Qualifications / experience required

Minimum of associates degree and 3+ years relevant experience.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with internal and external resources.
Ability to manage details of multiple projects.
Experience with SAP preferred.
Excellent computer and presentation skills; knowledge of MS Office/Sharepoint required.
Demonstrated success as both a team member and team leader.

A career with Bostik offers a collaborative work environment and supportive development to reach your career goals, with benefits starting day one as part of our competitive total rewards strategy. Bostik, an Arkema company, is a leading global adhesive specialist in construction, consumer and industrial markets. For more than a century, it has been developing innovative adhesive solutions that are smarter and more adaptive to the forces that shape daily lives. From cradle to grave, from home to office, Bostik’s smart adhesives can be found everywhere. With annual sales of €2 billion, the company employees 6,000 people and has a presence in more than 50 countries. www.bostik.com. The diversity of our employees is an asset we value and commit to from recruitment through career management. Bostik is an EEO/AA/Drug Free Workplace. Job Summary:

The Business Analysis Manager is responsible for leading a team of IT business analysts to support the planning, development, and implementation of technology solutions within the government sector. This position plays a critical role in understanding business needs, assessing existing systems, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that IT projects align with government objectives and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership:
Manage and lead a team of IT business analysts, providing guidance, mentorship, and performance management.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages professional development and knowledge sharing.
Business Analysis:
Identify, document, and analyze business processes, requirements, and objectives.
Develop and maintain a clear understanding of government policies, regulations, and procedures related to technology projects.
Collaborate with business units to define project scope and objectives.
Requirements Elicitation:
Engage with stakeholders to gather, validate, and prioritize requirements for IT projects.
Create detailed requirements documentation, including functional and technical specifications user stories and functional workflows
Solution Design and Planning:
Translate business requirements into technology solutions and systems.
Work with architects and technical teams to design efficient and cost-effective solutions.
Develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure successful project implementation.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing and validation of IT solutions to ensure they meet established requirements and government standards.
Implement quality control measures to identify and rectify defects in the systems.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Facilitate communication and collaboration between IT teams, government departments, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with government goals and objectives.
Compliance and Security:
Ensure that all IT solutions meet government security and compliance requirements.
Stay current with evolving regulations and implement necessary changes to maintain compliance.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain comprehensive records of project documentation, status reports, and project outcomes.
Prepare and present reports to senior management and government officials as required.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
At least 5 years of experience in IT business analysis, with 2 years in a managerial role.
Strong understanding of government operations, policies, and regulations.
Proven experience in leading and managing IT project teams.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies.
Knowledge of project management principles and methodologies (e.g., PMI, Agile, Scrum).
Familiarity with government-specific software and systems is a plus.
Professional certifications, such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional), PMP (Project Management Professional), or similar, are advantageous.

Work Mode: Hybrid

Location: Hybrid at Kohler, WI

Opportunity

Reporting to the Manager- Logistics Solutions this position is responsible developing and driving solutions that will improve operational performance, quality and customer satisfaction. The position will also support DC productivity metrics, inventory slotting, automation utilization and CI project management. Additionally, the Logistics Analyst will work to maintain inventory accuracy through reconciliation between SAP and Blue Yonder.


Specific Responsibilities

Functional skills:

Develop, implement and manage CI processes and initiatives
Train and motivate front line operators towards achieving quality, productivity and service targets.
Utilize Lean and other CI tools to identify areas of improvement and develop solution action plans.
Identify Industry and network best practices that can be documented and implemented across the DC network
Use a variety of data sources, including SAP and Blue Yonder to identify trends and improve efficiency through slotting/re-slotting items to balance workload and maximize throughput
Analyze data to identify consolidation opportunities to support and assist building leadership with capacity management
Analyze Automation utilization, capacity and throughput to improve mechanical and systems productivity.
Monitor outside/offsite storage inventory when applicable
Research quality claims, identify root cause and provide recommended solutions

Skills/Requirements

Bachelors degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Engineering or Management
2-3 years experience in Logistics Operations, Warehousing, Manufacturing or other front line operations business.
Experience in Lean/Six Sigma or other continuous improvement initiatives is highly preferred
Candidate should also have excellent leadership and communication skills, as well as the ability to engage and motivate cross-functional teams.
Basic knowledge in SAP, JDA/Blue Yonder WMS systems preferred.
Microsoft Skills (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint) are required. Accelerated MS-Excel experience is preferred.
Excellent written, verbal and organizational skills are required.

Testing experience is a plus

Horace Mann was founded in 1945 by two Springfield, Illinois, teachers who saw a need for quality, affordable auto insurance for teachers. Since then, we've broadened our mission to helping all educators protect what they have today and prepare for a successful tomorrow. And with our broadened mission has come corporate growth: We serve more than 4,100 school districts nationwide, we're publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange (symbol: HMN) and we have more than $12 billion in assets.

We're motivated by the fact that educators take care of our children's future, and we believe they deserve someone to look after theirs. We help educators identify their financial goals and develop plans to achieve them. This includes insurance to protect what they have today and financial products to help them prepare for their future. Our tailored offerings include special rates and benefits for educators.

About Foundation Finance:

Foundation Finance Company (FFC) is one of the fastest-growing consumer finance companies in the U.S. We work with home improvement contractors nationwide to help them close more sales through the use of flexible financing plans. FFC's full-spectrum lending approach has driven billions in originations and helped many customers make needed improvements to their homes. We're making big investments in both infrastructure and employee talent to keep up with our growth, so the time is right to join our team! It's a fast-paced environment with room to advance. Overview:

Business Intelligence Analyst Description & Duties:

The Business Intelligence Analyst will on a regular basis develop data-driven recommendations and present to senior management to improve business strategies and practices.


Duties may include, but are not limited to:

Responsibilities:
Dive into data and quickly become an expert on internal and non-traditional data sets. Use creativity and problem-solving acumen to identify trends and drive adjustments to our underwriting capabilities.
Develop performance reporting in Tableau and other media, present results to cross-functional teams and executive leadership.
Gather information for business intelligence from sources, such as market research reports, public records, field reports, or purchased findings. In addition to gathering information about customers and the market, grow and apply your knowledge of pertinent technological trends or emerging markets in our industry.
Examine data to provide market and financial intelligence reports that drive the critical path of the company.
Develop recommendations to improve returns, grow profitable loan originations and present results to executive leadership.
Gather information on issues, making recommendations for fixes to improve system performance and process efficiency.
Ensure risk and pricing models are soundly developed, accurately tested, and continually benchmarked.
Identify new insights, including external data sources that differentiate loan performance.
Assist with generating company performance through project cost-benefit analyses.
Other duties as assigned by management. Must be able to come to work promptly and regularly. Must be able to take direction and work well with others. Must be able to work under the stress of deadlines. Must be able to concentrate and perform accurately. Must be able to react to change productively.

The Ideal Candidate:

Applicants must be reliable, dynamic, sociable and enthusiastic team players; while possessing a positive "can-do" attitude, excellent judgement and communication skills. Applicants must also have great attention to detail and ability to multi-task under the stress of deadlines with a strong desire to help the organization succeed.
Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in finance, Mathematics, Engineering or similar quantitative field is required; master’s degree preferred.
Minimum 4 years’ experience in data analytics
R or Python 3+ years’ experience required, Tableau 3+ years’ experience required, Math & Statistics 3+ years’ experience required, SQL/VBA a plus.
demonstratable advanced use of Tableau.
Certified Analytics Professional (CAP®) is a plus.

The Maximo Business Analyst will provide leadership and support in delivering technology and information solutions that enhance productivity, lower costs, and improve information delivery for Operations in NEI’s three p. By identifying improvement opportunities in Maximo systems and focusing on developing solutions, the Company expects to maximize value from technology investments. This person will work closely with operations staff and corporate leadership to define and implement effective business process enhancements and technology solutions.

Maximo Business Analyst Essential Functions

Job duties may change over time, and additional job functions may become essential. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

o Be a lead resource in business process and system development for (CMMS/Maximo).

o Document and define business functions, technical and process specifications, and reporting requirements.

o Ensure the Maximo system is used efficiently and consistently through user support, documentation, and training.

o Support the client group in identifying issues, understanding the business needs/processes, and providing solutions.

o Communicate complicated technical concepts to non-technical users.

o Keep system setup codes, configurations, and documentation up to date to maintain standards and best practices, high performance of the Maximo system, reduce downtime, and high user productivity.

o Provide continuous system improvement by monitoring and evaluating current practices and designing and implementing enhancements that lower costs and extract the most value from the Maximo system.

o Developing system usage and data standards that enable common processes, reports, and skill development.

o Encouraging innovation, identifying opportunities, and sharing best practices to improve productivity and data quality.

o Communicate application problems and issues to key stakeholders, including management, development teams, and end-users.

o Develop reporting and KPIs to support new and existing codes of practice and reliability initiatives.

o Monitor applications performance and recommend improvements.

o Provide ad-hoc reporting, data queries, and dashboards in Maximo.

o Write and maintain documentation to describe program development, logic, system coding, testing, changes, and corrections per policy.

o Coordinate/create testing scripts and validate signoffs with process owners before moving changes into production.

o Work as the applications SME (Subject Matter Expert) to assist with system testing and signoff before loading new releases and patches into production.

Maximo Business Analyst Expected Areas of Competence (KSAs)

o Experience with and knowledge of CMMS Systems, specifically the IBM Maximo 7.6 and higher version.

o Knowledge of Windows-based hardware and software applications, including Microsoft Office Tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio), is required.

o Experience in advanced SQL and in writing advanced queries.

o Excellent communication and analytical skills are required.

o Excellent client relations and customer service skills are required.

o Knowledge of ERP Software Platforms.

o Knowledge of SAP is desirable.

o Maximo integration experience is a plus

This position description is intended to cover the most significant, ongoing job functions and competency areas. Successful performance in the role will require performing satisfactorily other duties as assigned.

Maximo Business Analyst Education and Experience Requirements

o 4 Year Degree in Information Sciences or related curriculum and three years of Business, Operations, or IT experience or 2 Year Degree in Information Technology and a minimum of 3 years of Business, Operations, or IT experience

o 3+ years of demonstrated experience with IBM Maximo working as a Functional Consultant/Business Analyst.

Maximo Business Analyst Physical Requirements

Sedentary work. Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally.

The worker must be able to access, analyze and otherwise work with, enter information stored in or obtained through the Company's computer system, and to communicate effectively with co-workers and third parties who have business dealings with the Company's operations.

Core work hours are 7:30am to 4:30pm Monday through Friday – Extra time as required to implement programs, provide emergency support, and perform general system maintenance. Use of a keyboard and mouse at least 80% of the day is necessary.

Maximo Business Analyst Travel Requirements

Occasional travel may be required to other NEI sites.

Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. All offers of employment will be conditioned upon successful completion of a post-offer, pre-hire background check and drug screen. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

NEI is an equal opportunity employer and applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability status, or national origin.

WAUSAU – DUDLEY TOWER OFFICE

JOIN OUR TEAM!
If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in a professional and fun work environment, look no further than WoodTrust Bank! We value every associate and appreciate the importance each individual role contributes to our success. We are currently seeking a motivated, detail-oriented person for an Investment Operations and Research Analyst in our Investment Management and Trust department at our Dudley Tower office in Wausau.

WHY WE’RE DIFFERENT
Did You Know? At over $5 billion in client assets under management and $650 million in bank assets, WoodTrust is one of the largest privately owned, full service financial institutions headquartered in central and northern Wisconsin, serving individual, family, corporate and not-for-profit customers in 35 states. With an acute focus on our core value, the customer is #1, WoodTrust has succeeded as a quality, community-focused financial institution since its founding in 1891.

In addition to our pursuit of life-time customers, we seek to provide associates an environment that allows them to learn, grow and succeed with an emphasis on hiring for the long-term and incentivizing teammates to spend the duration of their careers with WoodTrust. If you are interested in a career in financial services, want to work with fun and talented professionals, and grow with a private, family-owned organization, you would be a great fit for our team!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN INVESTMENT RESEARCH AND OPERATIONS ANALYST
As an Investment Research and Operations Analyst, you will:

Provide regular reporting on performance (absolute and vs. benchmarks), asset allocation and trends
Assist Portfolio Managers as needed with trading, transaction processing and account maintenance
Oversee corporate actions, corporate litigations, proxy-voting, in-out of balance monitoring, security pricing and worthless/non-transferrable securities
Coordinate, develop and maintain customized presentation materials for internal and external use
Perform both bottom-up and top-down research and security analysis on behalf of the Research Committee across various asset classes and investment programs
Assist in the creation of written client communication materials

The candidate for this position should have an interest in investment communication and reporting, securities trading, and investment analysis. Education or past experience should reflect this interest.

The Investment Operations and Research Analyst will report directly to our Director of Research and will have significant interaction with the firm’s Investment Committee and Research Committee, client service team and third-party managers.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE



A Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business or Economics is preferred
1-3 years of experience in an investment operations or research capacity is preferred
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel and PowerPoint, specifically).

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Attention to detail, a high degree of accuracy and the ability to multi-task are essential to this position as well as a solid understanding of math concepts, good written communication skills and a desire to solve problems. Other beneficial qualities include assertiveness, the ability to make timely decisions as well as take and give good direction. This position will require the person to work a minimum of 40 hours per week.

Must enjoy people and be willing and eager to interact pleasantly with customers and fellow associates alike. Must understand the team concept and be able to function as a member of a team as the team works towards a common goal. It is essential to observe the strictest secrecy and confidentiality on the subject of accounts and activities of any kind dealing with the bank.

WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?
WoodTrust strives to be an employer of choice, placing a major emphasis on personal and professional development. We offer competitive pay, a full benefit package including medical, dental, vision, vacation, sick leave and a 401(k) matching program along with a bank-wide annual bonus sharing program.

Please submit your application and resume by email to jobs@woodtrust.com or in person at one of our branch locations in Wisconsin Rapids, Plover or Wausau, WI.

WoodTrust is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Description

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for performing system and process analysis. This position will assist in implementing new business applications as well as identifying opportunities and enhancements to improve current business applications. The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with the business leaders, functional areas, and the technology teams to research, analyze, document, and recommend solutions that are appropriate for business needs and technology strategies.

Responsibilities

Responsible for leading business requirements definition to successful completion; including the discovery, analysis and documentation of business requirements, process flows, use cases, test cases, and training plans.
Review, analyze, and document workflows and their relationships to current and future state processes and solutions.
Supporting traceability from requirements through Quality Assurance (QA); assisting in creating User Acceptance Test (UAT) plans and providing oversight to business line testing.
Focus on continuous improvement with the business, reviewing both process and system functionality.
Assisting in the definition of roll out, training and user support plans.
Assist in the development and maintenance of standard procedures and best practices for system use.
Assist in identifying and developing additional business opportunities within current clients, applying delivery methodology standards in the creation of solutions and artifacts; understanding client tactical plans and goals.
Maintains and develops internal business relationships to influence successful project outcomes.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, IT or a related field OR equivalent work experience.
7+ years business analyst experience.
Proficient in Azure DevOps.
Proven experience working in an Agile (Scrum) environment.
Strong ability in writing acceptance criteria for user stories and sprint planning.
Previous program management experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
The ability to interact professionally at all levels.
The ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.
Strong process and principle-based problem-solving capabilities.

Knowledge / Skills / Availabilities

Ability to utilize IT best practices and tools related to analysis, documentation, program management and implementation.
Effective meeting facilitation.
Ability to learn quickly including tools and concepts.
The ability to lead through influence and persuasion.
Program management and project implementation experience.
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to communicate ideas and viewpoints to the senior management.
Experience with eCommerce, ERP, CRM, WMS, and TMS systems is desirable.

The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for performing business systems analysis and support of company-wide HR business applications. The Business Systems Analyst acts as a liaison between IT teams and HR teams. This position will use standard tools, processes, templates, and models to create clear and understandable documentation for Standard Operating Procedures, problems, opportunities, current state, future state, and business specifications. This position will help the business with test scripts, scenarios, and testing procedures. This position will work with cross-functional teams to devise and implement solutions and will also be required to document and maintain system configurations.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Support functional areas and maintain configuration for the following: Payroll, Time Tracking, Scheduling, and Absence.
Gather requirements for, create, and maintain data and configuration changes required to accommodate security, organizational and business process requirements.
Work closely with workstream leads, business partners, and cross-functional business teams and stakeholders to understand business processes, goals, and gaps. Work with them to find effective solutions. Propose modifications and enhancements to improve functionality or address any issues that arise.
Facilitate and drive the design, configuration, and deployment of new projects & system enhancements.
Implementation: Assist in gathering business requirements, analyzing, providing conceptual and detail design to meet business needs, manage configurations in Workday, test and support the rollout of the solution
Implementation: Participate in the change management and go live support processes
Participate in Workday upgrade preparation and release activities, including feature review, impact analysis, regression testing, education, and updates to training materials.
Perform risk analysis, and lead key functional stakeholders through impact analysis, enhancements, change request, and product upgrades.
Provide incident and problem management for application related issues.
Proactively focus on continuous improvement with the business, reviewing both process and system functionality
Work with vendor technical support on routine issues. Engage external vendors to improve the application through support calls and engage internal resources to resolve the issue.
Research new application features, understand their viability within the organization and contribute to projects related to those applications. Utilize the research findings to suggest improvements.
Participate in test efforts by creating use cases, user stories, scenario designs and use case diagrams. Support test resources with functional questions and defect resolution where appropriate.

Minimum Qualifications:
Associates degree in the field of Computer Science, MIS, Business or related field OR equivalent experience
3 years of experience providing Business Application systems, documentation, analysis, and support.

Preferred Qualifications:

Join our team! We have an exciting opening for a full-time Lead Business Analyst to join our team in Madison, Wisconsin!

The role of a Lead Business Analyst is focused on providing Business Analysis services independently for multiple projects of any size. As a BA, you will take deep dives into a client’s business, understand the client’s domain and their business needs, and work to design and create a solution alongside Yahara’s engineering staff. Business Analysts are critical in orchestrating the development by writing user stories, updating the product roadmap, and representing the client users in scrum agile meetings. The following can be expected of a Lead Business Analyst at Yahara Software.

Experience:

Job Qualification

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent BA experience.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively verbally, as well as through written word and formal presentations.
Demonstrated interpersonal, collaborative, and relationship-building skills.
Proficient in the use of technologies such as Zoom, Slack and Skype for remote professional communications.
Demonstrated high degree of initiative and ownership; proactively works to resolve issues.
Demonstrated ability to build trust and create lasting relationships. Must have experience working on a team.
Demonstrated ability to escalate timely to technical lead, management or client and work effectively to eliminate roadblocks.
Experience working with Waterfall and Agile Methodologies and understanding and flexibility to know when to use appropriate methodology or practices.
Able to learn new technology well enough to communicate with technology experts.

General Job Duties

Conducting requirements-gathering sessions with numerous stakeholders for what the future-state solution should provide.
Analyzing complex business problems and assessing how automated systems can be leveraged to help solve them.
Formulating and defining the stakeholders’ objectives into a recommendation of potential solutions.
Researching the client’s market competitive advantages and disadvantages and what external pressures may apply from the project manager and working those into the overall solution design.
Organizing the requirements into feature-sets and prioritizing them into ‘mandatory’ versus ‘desired’ buckets.
Building functionality proposals in collaboration with Technical Lead.
Converting requirements and solutions designed in collaboration with Tech lead into stories in support of development activities such as estimating, development and testing.
Tracking requirements as they progress through development activities.
Supporting the project manager in the creation of key client-facing deliverables such as the product roadmap, Return on Investment metrics, and budget snapshots.
Utilization of rapid prototyping tools such as JustinMind, Sketch, or Zephyr to facilitate development and maximize usability of application features.
Utilization of requirements analysis tools such as flow charts, sequence diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, fishbone diagrams etc.
Working as liaison between Yahara and its clients to facilitate, encourage, motivate User Acceptance Testing, gathering testing feedback, prioritizing bug fixes, and negotiating acceptance from the client.
Provide guidance to Project Coordinators to lead scrum cadences such as stand ups, backlog grooming and estimation, sprint planning and sprint close demos.
Identifying project risks and escalating to project manager from the product development point of view.
Assisting sales department to write responses to requests for proposals (RFP’s.)
Staying up to date and incorporating learnings from IIBA, or other industry standard entities, for software development best practices.

Job Summary:

The School of Human Ecology Business Affairs Team consists of teams in the areas of Budget/Finance, Human Resources, IT/Facilities, and Grants administration. Reporting to the Associate Dean of Administration and Finance, The Business Affairs Analyst will be a new addition that provides cross functional analytical, planning, and implementation expertise and support to the entire Business Affairs Team. Working in partnership with the Business Affairs Team members, this position will enhance strategic planning capacity, operational efficiencies, and ensure timely and accurate delivery of core services to the School at-large. This position will conduct organizational, policy, fiscal and management studies as needed or directed. This includes analyzing the School's financial, administrative and programmatic operations through data analysis, model building, and benchmarking. This position will also provide operational support and planning capacity to the Business Affairs Team by reviewing, analyzing, recommending, and implementing changes to internal policies and procedures. The Business Affairs Team greatly values collaborative team members who are interested in learning about different topics, units, issues, projects, etc., and who are committed to embracing and implementing positive change in key areas.

Responsibilities:
Manages a program and/or programmatic activities. Initiates, develops, and implements operational services that support a defined project, program, work unit, or function to advance program goals and objectives. May supervise staff and/or approve unit expenditures.
15% Plans, implements, executes, and evaluates existing strategies and objectives for a program and makes recommendations to unit leadership for program or function enhancement
15% Identifies workflow needs, contributes to the development of strategic and operational solutions, allocates resources, and implements new or revised unit operational policies and procedures
10% Schedules logistics and secures resources for program activities across multiple work units to ensure optimum efficiency and compliance with appropriate policies, procedures, and specifications
20% Leads the development and preparation of periodic reports and financial statements, and records progress, status, or other special reports for leadership or external agencies
35% May assist in the development and monitoring of the unit or program budget and approve unit expenditures
5% Contributes to the preparation of proposals for funding and/or funding continuation from outside sponsors

Description:

Under the direction of the General Manager, the Business Analyst will serve as a vital link between manufacturing and business processes. Duties for this position will include detailed requirements analysis, documenting current and future state business processes, advising on potential process improvements, planning and coordinating user acceptance testing and system integrations. This position will manage projects related to systems, which include our ERP, production and shipping systems. This is a non-supervisory position.



Gather and analyze project requirements using various methods such as analytical, interviewing, and data gathering techniques; understanding of current systems and analysis of business operations; and business-modeling methods.
Develop and implement test plans / scenarios to ensure successful project delivery.
Provide support to various business and technology teams as necessary during design, development and delivery to ensure solid, scalable, robust solutions.
Help identify, assess, and mitigate risks associated with each solution/design.
Prepare communication plans and reports for key stakeholders.
Based on business user requirements, prepare Request for Proposals (RFP) for 3rd party vendors and consultants and evaluate potential solutions based on identified criteria.
Coach, mentor, and train staff on business analysis and project management methodology.
Provide project leadership, work direction and feedback.
Motivate work of others outside of direct authority to ensure project milestones and deliverables are met.
Communicate and work with consultants as needed.
Work closely in a global team environment
Assist in creating and developing policies and procedures for business analysis and project management.
Assist with developing the long-term strategic goals and budget planning.
Perform other duties as requested by the department manager.

Other projects as needed.

Requirements:

Education:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field required

Experience:

3-5 years Project Management experience
3-5 years Business Analyst experience
3 plus years of WorkWise experience required
Minimum of at least 1 full life cycle WorkWise MRP / ERP implementation preferred.
Experience executing on-time, on-budget project to completion involving cross functional team

Other Requirements:

Advanced computer skills required
Excellent communication and organizational skills
PMP or other related certifications a plus
Thorough understanding of system development life cycle models and methodologies
Thorough understanding of ERP systems and processes
Demonstrated effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Ability to thrive in a diverse, collaborative, team-oriented environment where change occurs often
Strong sense of initiative and a sense of urgency, demonstrated by accomplishing tasks; improving current work processes; and assisting others when necessary
Unwavering attention to detail and commitment to world-class quality
Ability to embrace deadlines

Able to project a positive and professional demeanor to all internal and external contacts

Jewelers Mutual Insurance Company, the nation's only company exclusively insuring the jewelry industry is hiring for a Senior Business Analyst to work hybrid in our Neenah, WI or Dallas, TX office!

WHY Jewelers Mutual:

We are a financially secure, exceptionally positioned, and intellectually curious company driven by our core values of Agility, Accountability and Relevancy! We continue to raise the tide of the jewelry industry we’ve served since 1913 through our innovative people, our unyielding customer commitment, and evolution of our products and services to be the most trusted advisor to all we serve.

With a generous benefits package, office locations throughout the United States, and a mantra of “making your mark today”, consider evolving your career and shining bright with Jewelers Mutual Group!

Position Summary:

The Sr. BA will play a lead role in the evaluation of Jewelers Mutual’s current systems and processes by identifying and communicating needs between business areas, technology teams and support teams. Supports one or more moderately to highly complex business processes. Serves as a team member, sometimes as a technical lead. Also works at a high level to analyze business area needs, then recommends and defines solutions to address business challenges and desired outcomes.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Planning & Execution Activities

Determines which techniques and artifacts should be used for each project based upon size, complexity and stakeholders
Identifies all stakeholders
Helps communicate and mitigate risks to ensure project success
Responds to changing organizational priorities
Works closely with project managers and assists with the project planning
Provides input from a business and IT perspective
Conducts data gathering and analysis to understand business strategy requirements
Contributes to the business short-and long-term planning sessions and provides direction to ensure understanding of business goals and direction
May generate appropriate communication, process and educational plans for mitigating the disruption of change
May identify and remove obstacles to change

Requirements Gathering

Ensures stakeholders are involved in requirements gathering activities
Obtains needed information from stakeholders to form requirements
Captures information provided in formal and informal meeting environments
Prepares requirements documentation in format understandable to the recipient audience
Ensures requirement traceability through all phases of a project / program
Strives to eliminate ambiguity in, or varying interpretations of requirements
Assesses stakeholder needs utilizing a structured requirements process to assist in identifying
business priorities and advises on options
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions

Analysis, Management & Communication

Obtains, organizes and categorizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needs.
Documents the business requirements and functional specifications which express what actions the business must take in order to solve a business need and delivers work artifacts through the project lifecycle
Ensures that all requirements and designs support the delivery of value, fulfill goals and business outcomes
Offers input on priority of requirements based on time, cost, scope, strategic fit and return on investment
Obtains approvals for each artifact generated
Analyzes and articulates impacts of changes to requirements
Appropriately responds to changing requirements
Identifies opportunities for improvement and proposes solutions to impacted areas
Takes ownership of conflict and issue resolution
Coaches and transfers knowledge to less experienced team members.
Keeps stakeholders informed of problems, issues, and resolutions
Varies communication method / style based on stakeholder or group
Understands organizational culture, structure and impact on work efforts
Understands enterprise architecture concepts and can assess business capability needs
Effectively identify, understand and communicate business impacts/outcomes across the organization functioning as a business architect/enterprise analyst
Establishes and maintains liaison relationship with business units and IT in order to provide effective technical solutions
Seeks opportunities to improve and deepen relationship between IT and business units
Analyzes performance metrics to ensure stakeholder satisfaction.
Manages stakeholder expectations
Analyzes stakeholder operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities for improvements
Provides assistance in business case development (i.e., research, data collection)
Reviews test plans
Monitors testing process to ensure that business results are adequately tested with minimal risk
Ensures test strategies involve appropriate integration and process components
Provides a concise list of solution options considered including a recommended solution
Assesses the organizational readiness for the new solution
Outline business capabilities and requirements to move from the current to future state
Verify and validate that proposed solutions meet business needs / outcomes
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.

Education and/or Experience

A Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university. Equivalent work experience in a similar position may be substituted for educational requirements.
Ideal candidates will have a minimum of five to seven years of increasingly responsible experience in information technology with an emphasis on business architecture & business analysis.
Experience in gathering and/or developing requirements for multi-channel / omni-channel digital marketplaces, B2B portals & B2C portals.
Property/casualty insurance, financial services and/or jewelry industry experience is desired, but not required.

Computer Skills

Proficiency in common Microsoft applications, including MS Office Suite, Visio, SharePoint and Outlook. Working knowledge of project management applications, Mind Mapping Software, and prototyping applications (e.g. Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Azure, iRise, Microsoft Expression Studio).

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification and/or Usability (UX) Certifications are desirable.

Job Title: Software Product Analyst/IT Business Analyst (Hybrid Work Model)
Job Description:
At Sentry, we’re more than just insurance—and we can offer you more than just a job. We want you to enjoy a career with us, where you’re in the driver’s seat of your career path with access to resources to help you succeed personally and professionally.

What You’ll Receive

You want a positive work/life balance. Our hybrid work model allows you to enjoy the benefits of working from home on Monday and Friday, but also provides the opportunity for team building and collaboration when working in the office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. To help you work effectively and comfortably in both locations, we provide you with equipment to work at home and in the office.

You can enjoy a complete benefits package, including generous paid time off, 8% 401(k) match, matching charitable gift program, bonus plan based on company performance, meal stipends, associate discounts, and volunteer time off.

About Sentry

Our background: We’re one of the largest and most financially secure mutual insurance groups in the nation. More than 4,000 strong, our associates bring together diverse backgrounds, experiences, and skill sets to make Sentry who we are. We’re No. 658 on the Fortune 1000 list and named one of America’s Best Midsize Employers by Forbes. We’re in the business of helping others, and that includes the communities where we live and work. Our annual United Way campaign has raised more than $1 million for the past seven years.

Our Stevens Point campus offers a full-service fitness center, swimming pool, basketball and racquetball courts, auto center, credit union, on-site Aspirus clinic, restaurants, boutique hotel, and the award-winning SentryWorld golf course.

This position can be filled as a Software Product Analyst or Senior Software Product Analyst based on the qualifications and experience of the selected candidate.

What You’ll Do

You’re a valuable contributor. As an associate at Sentry, we believe in your skills and knowledge. Your input and participation matters. You’ll have the opportunity to:

Innovate: Through our scaled agile development process, you’ll have dedicated time to apply your creativity and innovation to drive new solutions.

Learn: Sentry provides several resources for furthering your career and continuing your personal development, including Sentry University, LinkedIn Learning, and developer-led educational sessions and communities.

Grow: Sentry provides many opportunities to grow in your career. Through meaningful, ongoing conversations around growth and development, we encourage all associates to take ownership in their career path.

Contribute: Our Software Product Analysts at Sentry are essential to our success of continuing to be innovative and competitive. As an Analyst you’ll:

Participate in discussions and interact with business users and customers to fully understand their business processes and work environment. Observe how they use software systems to do their job, and brainstorm ways to help them be more efficient and effective.

Learn to write crisp, concise requirements and user scenarios that clearly capture what the users want and help engineering bring them to life in software.

Learn to create comprehensive test cases to validate new system features. Work closely with engineering to ensure the system works and performs as intended. Work to anticipate users’ actions to find hidden system defects.

Gain a full understanding of how we develop software and provide ideas and perspective on how we could do it better. Develop a basic technical understanding. Be able to explain the technical building blocks and how information flows within our systems to users of the applications.

If you have experience or knowledge in one of the preferred skills listed above, we want you to consider joining the Sentry team!

How You’ll Apply

We’d love for you to join us. Please complete your online application and upload your resume on our Careers site. If you have applied with us before, you only need to provide your email address and password. If this is your first time applying with Sentry, please create an account.

If you have specific questions regarding the position, application process, or are interested in learning more about Sentry, please reach out to Katelynne Rivera, Talent Acquisition Specialist.

Get ready to own your future at Sentry. Your opportunity awaits.

Talent Acquisition Specialist

Thank you for your interest in Sentry!

Katelynne Rivera

KATELYNNE.RIVERA@SENTRY.COM

Equal Employment Opportunity

Sentry is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy that there be no discrimination in employment based on race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, age, marital status, or sexual orientation.

Job Description:
The Business Systems Analyst position is part of the Data, Technology and Engineering (DTE) team, supporting Quality Systems and Vertex Innovation and External Research (VIER). This position is responsible for supporting and enhancing Vertex’s Learning Management SAAS solution provided by Cornerstone on Demand.

As Vertex works to build and enhance our existing system, we are seeking an individual who will help us research, configure, test, and document solutions to issues identified by our business stakeholders. This individual will partner with other Subject Matter Experts, both internally and via third parties. They will help us ensure that we provide a system that meets the compliance needs demanded in a validated environment while continuing to enhance Vertex’s learning ecosystem via the Learning Advancement Program.

Qualified candidates will have:
Cornerstone (or similar LMS technical experience)
GxP validation experience
System Administration, integration, and configuration experience

*** this role will not include the creating or assigning of training content ***

Key Responsibilities:
Participate in day-to-day project and support work, including analysis, documentation, configuration, testing, integration, and reporting activities.
Conduct systems analysis and configuration changes in accordance with industry Systems Lifecycle (SLC) and Vertex Change Management guidelines for a validated environment
Implement product enhancements; understand and document business processes and requirements
Manage customer support cases via case management tool
Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing regularly scheduled system upgrades
Develop collaborative relationships with IT peers, Talent Management, Quality Systems, external partners, and various operational teams to help design, develop, and deliver learning solutions that satisfy business requirements
Translate technically complex analysis into easily comprehensible terms
Ensure data integrity including quality, accuracy, security, and usability of employee data and related interfaces by adhering to established processes and controls

Minimum Qualifications/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technical discipline
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new tools based on conceptual understanding of technology
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Flexibility to adapt to a continually changing and fast paced business environment
Effective communications and presentation skills
Demonstrate an understanding of good project management practices as well as the fundamentals of the System Lifecyle (SLC) and Information Technology operational practices
Familiar with Microsoft Office products (e.g. Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote)
Experience administering Cornerstone on Demand preferred
Experience with Learning Management Systems preferred
Pharmaceutical industry experience including GxP requirements preferred
Proficiency leveraging analytical languages and tools preferred (e.g. SQL, PowerBI)
Pay Range:
$80-$90/hr

Our culture of inclusion and collaboration enables us to support our members’ financial wellbeing, positively impact the communities we serve, and help our associates grow their careers. We strive to ensure you feel empowered to grow and succeed, while also feeling valued and taken care of, as we all do our part to put people first. NATURE AND SCOPE
The IT Operations Analyst reports to the VP, IT Infrastructure and Operations and is responsible for providing efficient support for the organization’s backend systems and services. This includes maintaining and upgrading various systems, monitoring backend infrastructure, managing patching for the organization, and serving as an escalation point for the IT Operations team.

REQUIREMENTS
1. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered. Industry qualifications preferred.
2. Minimum 5 years’ experience working in an IT Support role with server and application support responsibilities.

Two companies, one vision.
Menasha Corporation consists of two companies that are leading the way to a sustainable future with packaging and supply chain solutions. Founded in 1849 and headquartered in Neenah, Wisconsin, we employ over 7,500 employees in 112 facilities in North America and Europe.

About This Opportunity


We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Analyst with expertise in ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems to join our dynamic team. As a Business Analyst ERP, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our business needs and technology solutions. Your primary responsibility will be to analyze our organization's ERP requirements, streamline processes, and ensure the effective implementation and optimization of ERP solutions.

Global Finishing Solutions (GFS) is the leading manufacturer of paint booths and finishing systems for a wide variety of industries. Our strength is in custom building finishing equipment to meet the unique needs of each customer. From sales and engineering to marketing and manufacturing, this variety of work makes our jobs exciting.
