Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate, and above all fun.

About the team

We have big plans for our Call Center team! We are growing quickly, yet we remain focused on crafting an incredible experience for our clients. We value and expect thoughtfulness and high performance from everyone at FIS and look forward to having you on the team! Our Back Office Solutions team provides services that allow customers to realize increased operational efficiencies, improved speed to market, and improved customer satisfaction in a cost-effective manner.

What you will be doing:

Work from eligibility is based on performance and business needs; Associates will report to the office if their performance does NOT meet standards or if the client or FIS requires a return office.
Reviews, analyzes, and interprets correspondence related to account maintenance.
Ensures loan applications comply with governmental regulations and requirements by reviewing complex legal documents and regulatory requirements (Loan Operations Analyst).
Performs quality control on new and existing loans using internal reports and loan documentation to verify data input is correct and documents accurate and in regulatory compliance. (Loan Operations Analyst).
Communicates professionally with clients and third parties through multiple channels (phone, email, workflow tools).
Researches and resolves internal and externally submitted account questions and problems.
Performs high risk task processing including maintenance on accounts having regulatory or monetary implications, e.g., payment/research corrections, credit bureau dispute research, Reg Z disputes, loan payoff processing, fee processing, loan modifications. (Loan Operations Analyst).
Processes loan payoff requests and paid loans.
Follows up on insurance information, and processes insurance on accounts.
Processes payments and payment exceptions.
Performs escrow analyses. Prepares and executes annual escrow analyses.
Monitors daily reports and follows-up as required.

What you bring:

Excellent customer service skills that build high levels of customer satisfaction
Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Effective people skills and sensitivities when dealing with others

Added bonus if you have:

Banking or financial industry experience
Experience working with basic technical issues in a banking environment

What we offer you:

Attractive benefits including private medical cover, dental cover, and 3 weeks of paid vacation
A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!

Job Summary:
Are you ready to take the lead in managing impactful Infrastructure Projects? As the Infrastructure Solutions Manager, you’ll be at the forefront of driving success through effective project management, orchestrating key infrastructure projects, and ensuring seamless project execution and delivery for Hometown Grocers, Inc.

What Sets You Apart:
A track record of successfully managing diverse project portfolios
Proven ability to connect with and influence executive leaders
Strong project management skills, with a keen eye for organization & follow-up
A drive and passion for making a difference in every project you undertake, digging in & moving projects forward

Why Festival Foods?
Legacy of Stability and Growth: Join a Wisconsin-based grocer with a 75+ year legacy that continues to expand. Be part of a company that values tradition while fostering a culture of continuous growth.
Collaborative Excellence: Work alongside a dynamic team of Solutions Managers and Business Analysts, united in the pursuit of collective growth & excellence.
Employee & Family Ownership: Your dedication directly contributes to financial prosperity through our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). Over the last decade, associates have earned an impressive 9% on their ESOP balance, plus an additional 5% added to their account annually – a remarkable benefit on top of our 401k match!
Support for Work-Life Integration: We understand the importance of balance. Enjoy the flexibility to work remotely one day per week, and seize the opportunity to recharge with a comprehensive PTO package, including 15 days off and 6 paid company holidays.
Job Description:
Job Title: IT Solutions Manager
FLSA Status: Salary
Reports to Sr Director Applications Solutions and PMO

The IT Solutions Manager is responsible for planning, overseeing, and leading IT projects from ideation through completion. This includes analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of stakeholders, guests, or business partners, by interviewing stakeholders, gathering and compiling user requirements to understand the technology solutions they need. This role is also responsible for developing detailed project plans to ensure resource availability, allocation, and on-time project delivery within budget and scope. The IT Solutions Manager will also apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to guide the business towards make beneficial technology decisions. This role will require a proactive approach to collaboration with IT Peers when seeking new technologies to optimize business processes and will also play a pivotal role in ensuring Its understanding of business requirements.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Primary Responsibilities

Ensure that the project is completely and correctly planned according to established methodologies and standards.
Ensure that the project work plan is followed and is continually updated to ensure customer requirements are met in a timely manner.
Ensure appropriate communication and maintain contact with users, executive sponsor, department managers and directors and upper-level management personnel as directed by the methodology and the supervisor.
Keep manager and director informed on the status of all assigned projects.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to write requirements specifications accurately and concisely.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicating these back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements– verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Develop, maintain, and publish the project book according to Festival’s IT Project Methodology.
Assist in continuous process improvement initiatives as directed.
Assist in business process improvement initiatives through approved projects.
Promote technology where appropriate to add value to business process.
Coordinate with IT and business departments to determine staffing needs; delegate work assignments and coach Team Members to ensure systems are implemented according to specifications and standards.
Provide guidance and/or instruction as applicable.
Other duties as assigned.
Regular, timely attendance in compliance with the work schedule, and adequate notice to find a replacement for occasional absences.

Strategy & Planning

Manage IT projects from inception through completion utilizing Festival’s Project Management methodology.
Provide mentoring, consulting, and support of Festival’s Project Management methodology.
Collaborate with business partners to determine project value, scope, and vision.
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of Project Management and Business Analysis processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Manage vendor and outsourced projects and relationships as necessary.
Responsible for sponsor and Team Member satisfaction as it relates to project completion, project success criteria or as identified by Festival’s IT Department and Methodology.

Acquisition & Deployment

Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Participate in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Participate in the selection of any requirements documentation software solutions that the organization may opt to use.
Assist with solution implementation planning and solution implementations including software installations, documentation, and training.

QUALIFICATIONS

College diploma or university degree in the field of Business Administration, computer science, Finance, or Information Systems required.
3-5 years of directly related work experience (retail Large Enterprise preferred).
Business Analysis or Project Management certifications preferred.
Excellent supervisory, management and performance management skills; interpersonal skills; customer service skills; organizational skills; project management skills and knowledge of project management tools; and verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated knowledge of the organization’s core business process and operations.
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.
Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required.
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources.
Understanding of application development and software development life cycle concepts (i.e.: SCRUM and Agile).
Understanding of the organization’s core software applications, including POS, Merchandise and Marketing systems, Financial ERP and Financial reporting.
Able to exercise independent judgment and act on it.
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT

Sitting or standing at a computer 50% of the time.
Bending, stretching, and occasional lifting of up to 30 lbs. is required.
Dexterity of hands and fingers required to operate a computer keyboard or mouse, and to handle other computer components.


Work Schedule

The IT Solutions Manager is a full-time, salaried position. Occasional evening and weekend work to meet deadlines.




Company Overview: Founded in 1946 as Skogen's IGA, Festival Foods is a Wisconsin family- and employee-owned grocer that is committed to giving back to the communities it serves and to providing guests with exceptional service and value. The company, which began operating as Festival Foods in 1990, employs more than 8,000 full- and part-time associates and operates +40 full-service supermarkets across the state of Wisconsin. At Festival Foods we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all. We are dedicated to building a top-notch team of skilled, experienced and service-oriented associates who represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents. Festival Foods believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates, products, and our community strengthen our ability to serve our guests, as we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people.

Job Details

Description

Senior Business Process Improvement Analyst – Information Technology




At Johnson Outdoors, home to some of the world’s most innovative and best-known outdoor recreation brands, we create amazing outdoor experiences - for adventurers, by adventurers.

By joining the Johnson Outdoors IT team as the Senior Business Process Improvement Analyst you will have the opportunity to combine your amazing Project Management and JD Edwards (or other platforms) IT skills together to lead business process solutions. Become a part of a strong cross functional team that is motivated to drive process improvement projects that will produce benefits for our global manufacturing facilities and the Johnson Outdoors customers around the world.

Based in beautiful and affordable Racine, Wisconsin, at our Headquarters on the shore of Lake Michigan, you’ll have incredible access to a variety of outdoor activities whether skiing and snowmobiling in winter, or kayaking, fishing, sailing, hiking or more in summer. Close to both Milwaukee and Chicago, the area boasts a wide variety of amenities including a vibrant arts and culture scene and a host of unique, creative dining options. This role will work an in office hybrid schedule.

What you will do:

Drives the collaboration with specific business users to understand current business processes and requirements to document as appropriate.
Performs analysis of existing processes requirements and business changes to determine potential improvements to processes or system solutions.
Provides documentation of user requirements and reference guides for appropriate processes in enterprise applications including JD Edwards EnterpriseOne.
Performs setup and testing of all enterprise applications based on business and system support requirements
Assists, and often leads, the implementation of specific process enhancements.
Works to promote and manage change to utilize common processes and practices.
Leads, in collaboration with business leads, the training of business users on new system functionality.
Assists in data standardization and integration for projects and ongoing enterprise application support.
Performs other duties as assigned.



What you need to succeed:

Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, information technology or equivalent.
Typically requires a minimum of five years of experience implementing and supporting business solutions in enterprise planning/business analysis, supply chain management, forecasting, purchasing, manufacturing or distribution.
Experience successfully managing or leading multiple projects including coordination with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Skills leading business process improvement initiatives while deploying enterprise systems and solutions.
Experience with a variety of on-premise and hosted enterprise level applications. JD Edwards Enterprise One, preferred.
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate with all levels in the organization and external vendors, strong customer service orientation, excellent problem solving skills and the ability to drive for results.
Excellent workload management skills including the ability to successfully balance multiple priorities associated with complex multi-phase/multi-dimensional enterprise-wide projects.
Proficient in common productivity tools including Microsoft Office



A few pointers about our culture:

Entrepreneurial spirit and innovation are in our bones! We authentically innovate trusted equipment that gets people out there.
We are laser-focused on our consumers, and passionate about inspiring people to actively engage with the amazing awe of the outdoors again and again.
We strive to create meaningful, healthy change in the world as individuals and as a family of brands.
We value team members who are willing to wear many hats; who take personal initiative, anticipating what needs to be done, and figuring things out to make them happen; but who are also willing to ask for help, to assist others and work together.

What you will receive:

Share in the company’s success - Competitive base salary, with additional earning potential through participation in the annual discretionary cash profit sharing program, eligibility for annual pay increases, and employee stock purchase plans.
Find your work/life balance with generous paid time off and holiday benefits, health insurance and wellness plans.
Further your career with training opportunities including our tuition assistance program.
Plan for your future with our 401k with company match and deferred retirement contributions, Sons & Daughters Scholarship program, life and LTD insurance, employee stock purchase plan, and more.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at Johnson Outdoors (and all subsidiaries) without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law. Johnson Outdoors is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, please contact Human Resources at HRSpecialAccommodations@johnsonoutdoors.com to let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

About Us:

JOHNSON OUTDOORS is a leading global innovator of outdoor recreation equipment and technologies that inspire more people to experience the awe of the great outdoors. The company designs, manufactures and markets a portfolio of winning, consumer-preferred brands across four categories: Watercraft Recreation, Fishing, Diving and Camping. Johnson Outdoors' iconic brands include: Old Town® canoes and kayaks; Ocean Kayak™; Carlisle® paddles; Minn Kota® fishing motors, batteries and anchors; Cannon® downriggers; Humminbird® marine electronics and charts; SCUBAPRO® dive equipment; Jetboil® outdoor cooking systems; and, Eureka!®camping and hiking equipment. Founded in 1970 by Samuel C. Johnson, the Company has delivered double-digit compound annual growth over its history, evolving from a single brand into a nearly $743 million global enterprise with around 1,400 employees across 20 countries.

Viterbo University invites applications for a full-time Business Systems Programmer/Analyst position. The Programmer/Analyst position reports to the Director of Instructional and Information Technology. The Business Systems Programmer/Analyst will work within the Administrative Systems team to develop and support systems, processes and structures related to the management of institutional data & digital resources for the operational effectiveness of administrative offices. This can include but is not limited to assisting with the management, maintenance, and improvement of systems related to University's administrative software/hardware systems (Ellucian Colleague & Self-Service, SoftDocs Etrieve, MS Reporting Services(SSRS), SQL Server Integration Services(SSIS), Tableau Dashboarding, RS2 door card system), data integration between disparate systems, assisting business units in the use of technology tools to gain operational efficiency and overall transparency of data for Institutional use. This is a full-time, on- campus, year-round position eligible for employee benefits.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform programming, database report writing and software support tasks on the University's ERP system, which includes ColleagueUI, Ellucian Self-Service, Microsoft Reporting services and ColleagueAPI.
Export/Import and process data sets from the Colleague system using SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Server Integration Services, MS-Excel, MS-Access and SQL Management Studio tools for use in other systems/databases.
Serve as a primary support resource & coordinate the integration of data between the Ellucian Colleague system and other auxiliary systems, including but not limited to Raisers Edge, RS2, CSI, Transferology, Moodle, EMS, etc.
Assist end-users with the creation of custom reports using SQL Server Reporting Services, MS-Access, MS-Excel, Tableau Dashboards or other reporting tools. This includes meeting with users to define and translate their requirements into desired report formats.
Prepare any necessary documentation within programs or as part of a user manual. The documentation should clarify the intent of the procedure or help in using that procedure.
Assist assigned administrative offices with other PC-based software that is used to complete administrative tasks regardless of whether it directly interfaces with the Colleague system.
Monitor database integrity, complete security maintenance and file maintenance. Make recommendations for improvements whenever concerns are found, or performance can be enhanced.
Serve as a designated contact with Ellucian to troubleshoot and resolve issues with the Colleague software.
Maintain knowledge of supported products and applications via list serves, conferences, user groups and training.
Able to work off-hours to troubleshoot, install new systems and software upgrades.
Self directed; Team player; With the capacity to manage multiple projects while communicating progress and work to end users, team, or supervisor.
Perform other tasks as assigned by the Director of IIT

General Requirements/Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in IT related program is required. Knowledge of relational database software, programming and query languages is required. Demonstrable experience in troubleshooting of software and systems integrations is required. Three to five years of professional experience in an equivalent position a plus. Experience with Microsoft SQL server, SSIS, SSRS preferred. Higher Education Student Information Systems support a plus. Excellent Customer Service, written and verbal skills are essential. Experience programming in Jquery, Java Script, ASP.NET, HTML is a plus. Must be authorized to work in the United States. Viterbo University is unable to sponsor or take over the sponsorship of the employment Visa.

To Apply: Please complete the online employment application form and upload a letter of interest, CV/resume, and three professional references.

Review of Application: The review of applications will start end middle of November and will be ongoing until the position is filled.

About the University: Viterbo University is a Catholic, Franciscan, liberal arts institution with an enrollment of nearly 3000 students. Viterbo is located in scenic La Crosse, Wisconsin, which has been rated as one of the top places to live in the US. The region features an attractive cost of living, beautiful bluffs and coulees, three major rivers including the Mississippi River, world-class health care and education systems, and easy access to major cities in Wisconsin, Minnesota, and Illinois.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement: At Viterbo University, we value our inclusive climate and understand that diversity in experiences and perspectives is vital to advancing innovation, critical thinking, solving complex problems, and creating an inclusive academic community. We translate these values into action by seeking individuals who have experience and expertise working with diverse students, colleagues, constituencies, and those who will help us advance our diversity and inclusion initiatives aimed at creating a university that values student, staff, and faculty engagement in addressing issues of diversity and inclusiveness.

Viterbo University provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment, encourages nominations and candidacy of historically underrepresented groups, and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Viterbo University is an equal opportunity employer and encourages nominations and candidacy of historically underrepresented groups.

Description

This position will work closely with the Corporate Compliance Coordinator, the Quality Assurance Performance Improvement (QAPI) team, Health Information Management (HIM), and HHS leadership in developing, promoting, and supporting a department wide QAPI plan that will ensure WCDHHS is compliant with program, accreditation, and operational requirements and Federal, State, and Local laws, rules, and regulations. Further the Business CQI Analyst will help senior management to drive the strategy execution through designing new business models; streamlining and reengineering existing business processes and providing support to change management.

The position will have an important role in quality assurance, training, developing business policy and procedures, market analysis, organizational development and solution testing to improve business performance that include, but are not limited to the following:



Oversee and coordinate process improvement projects looking for all the HHS divisions to understand, refine and improve on the business operations.
Facilitates quality assurance reviews to focus on fixing business process through workflow. Not necessarily concerned with technical solutions or software development.
Identifies vulnerabilities in processes and devise data-driven solutions for improvements to provide direction to divisions/units.
Acts as the liaison between IT and HHS management team.
Converts the findings of the QAPI into practical remedies for business improvement.
Coordinates the gathering and analyzing data to identify needs and recommend solutions. Work across teams to eliminate redundancies and improve efficiency.
Leads division staff in using data to analyze the way in which the operations are impacting the department to generate efficiencies. Add value through enabling efficiency to be maximized through cost cuts, investing in equipment, and improving employee efficiency.
Manages project resources, creates business process workflows, sets deadlines, coordinates with executive team, and provides regular updates. Includes sponsoring project teams and ensuring project completion.
Utilizes Lean, Organizational Effectiveness, Six Sigma, and other tools to improve organizational operations.
Collects, analyzes, and reports on performance data for all the HHS divisions.
Develops and/or revises divisional QAPI plans to ensure they align with the department wide plan and with any program and regulatory requirements.
Provides oversight of scheduling, monitoring, and when necessary, performing program audits and reviews that will consist of:
Conducting compliance and clinical quality record reviews.
Conducting compliance reviews ensuring service and billing codes are appropriately matched and billing/coding errors are identified, reported, and corrected.
Documenting findings and corrective actions needed.
Identifying and assisting with training needs and/or opportunities resulting from audits and reviews.
Reporting results to the Compliance Program Coordinator, leadership, and applicable committees.
Advising program leadership and workforce members of opportunities for improvement.
Interviews subject matter experts and other stakeholders on division/unit business processes and independently researches program requirements.
Develops continuous improvement projects, QAPI activities, and training plans HHS department wide.
Participates in policy and procedure development and reviews.
Performs other duties in support of continuous improvement, QAPI, and as assigned.

This position is authorized for 3 years and will sunset on 12/31/26.

Example of Duties

Under direction, to perform advanced professional work in the development, implementation, and administration of automated financial, accounting, budgeting, business management, and/or investment activities on a Countywide basis, and to perform other duties as required.



Performs advanced level financial analysis to assist departments with the development, preparation, and monitoring of complex operating budgets and capital improvement project requests.
Develops and monitors the five (5) year capital projects plan which involves being responsible for establishing and communicating procedures to department management; establishing and monitoring deadlines for the review process; reviewing and modifying project requests for financial impact, reasonableness, and quality; proposing recommendations to the plan for fiscal sustainability; compiling financial summary and narrative materials for department management, the County Executive, the County Board, and the public; and delivering the final proposed capital plan to the County Board.
Develops and monitors the County investment policy.
Prepares and analyzes property tax accounts and administers the financial accounting system.
Develops, analyzes, and interprets complex financial and statistical data to determine the costs of positions, programs, grants, labor contracts, interdepartmental charges, or department operations.
Develops information with report writing tools for the analysis, modeling, development, and monitoring of departmental operating budgets and program analysis.
Evaluates financial programs and projects operations to assess future budget funding needs.
Coordinates, reviews, and records complex accounting, budget, or investment transactions; makes allocations to designated accounts and funds.
Develops the debt service budget and works with a financial advisor to manage the County’s bonds program; coordinates the official statement, ordinances, and bond agency presentation.
Develops the County’s long range financial plan based on modeling of current and projected economic and financial trends, capital projects and operating impacts, and changes in the operating environment.
Develops and monitors County’s key statistical monitoring indicators including financial performance and economic environment.
Monitors the execution of operating or replacement fund budgets, investigates variances from projected expenditures or revenues, and recommends corrective actions to the County Board, County Executive, department heads and other employees.
Designs, implements, reviews, and maintains detailed financial reports and computerized systems for proper implementation of financial procedures.
Administers a computerized budget and project accounting information system; coordinates and implements modifications to the system and annual budget book; performs system maintenance, problem resolution, and user training.
Assists in compiling financial data for external auditors and in performing internal audit fieldwork, including program evaluations and reviews.
Plans, assigns, reviews, evaluates, and coordinates the work of clerical and other department personnel in accounting, payroll, budgeting, billing, or investment areas, and provides necessary training.
Interprets, analyzes, and advises on new financial related laws, codes, regulations, or accounting standards; determines potential impact for the department and makes recommendations for appropriate course of action.
Coordinates the State budget review process by conducting programmatic and fiscal reviews of local, state, and federal legislation, identifying and analyzing non-County funding sources, and determining impacts on County budget.
Advises on generally accepted accounting principles, laws, codes, and regulations and recommends department tax levy targets, internal control, accounting, and budgeting treatment for financial transactions and procedures.
Advises on the application of complex budget policies and procedures.
Leads or participates in work groups and coordinates special projects including organizational changes, new service delivery, new planning efforts, new facilities, and new uses of technology.
Analyzes and recommends changes in budget policies, procedures, and practices including improvements to the budget process and systems.
Coordinates acquisition process for various financially related services from third party vendors.
Establishes and maintains effective working relations with employees at all levels within the County, representatives of other agencies, financial institutions, auditors, vendors, and elected officials.
May advise division manager, department head, and County Treasurer on investment-related issues, and changes to investment policy.
May develop and compile applications for reimbursement of costs incurred.
May provide technical advice in the design of financial management computer application.
May advise the County Executive, County Board, department heads and committee boards by providing information and recommendations on fiscal impact and cost-benefit analysis of county activities.
Performs other duties as required.


QUALIFICATIONS
Essential Knowledge and Abilities

Comprehensive knowledge of investments, financial markets, and cash management.
Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, practices and procedures of governmental appropriation, budgeting, and financing including capital projects planning, debt issuance, and tax-exempt financing.
Comprehensive knowledge of the principles and techniques of financial and statistical analysis and financial modeling and forecasting.
Comprehensive knowledge of the modern principles, practices, and procedures of general accounting, payroll management, administration, and management, as applied to governmental entities.
Comprehensive knowledge of the governmental budgeting process and fund (governmental) accounting.
Comprehensive knowledge of data processing applications as they relate to accounting: spreadsheets, relational database applications, presentation graphics, word processing, governmental accounting applications.
Considerable knowledge of modern principles and practices of governmental fiscal reporting and accounting.
Considerable knowledge of the principles of auditing in the public sector, particularly as applied to budget development and control, or accounting.
Considerable knowledge of modern principles and practices of administration including policy and procedure development and implementation, communications, staffing and financial and management controls.
Considerable knowledge of an array of county operations, services and programs being provided.
Ability to gather, analyze and evaluate data; maintain accurate and detailed records and prepare comprehensive recommendations and reports.
Ability to plan, prioritize, organize complex fiscal data, and effectively carry out a variety of assignments.
Ability to utilize word processing, financial and accounting spreadsheet and database applications, presentation tools, and integrated financial systems.
Ability to manage multiple priorities with minimal direction, while meeting specified deadlines.
Ability to initiate, develop and install accounting and budgeting procedures and to evaluate their effectiveness.
Ability to communicate and work within a team environment.
Ability to prepare and maintain accurate and complete records and reports.
Ability to plan, organize, and review the work of others.
Ability to effectively present ideas and concepts to others, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees at all levels within the County, representatives of other agencies, financial institutions, auditors, vendors, and elected officials.
Ability to effectively interact with sensitivity with persons from diverse cultural, socioeconomic, educational, racial, ethnic, and professional backgrounds, and persons of all ages and lifestyles.

Minimum Qualifications

You must meet these minimum Training and Experience requirements:

Graduation from a recognized college or university with a bachelor's degree in business administration, public administration, accounting, finance, or a closely related field.
Three (3) years of responsible professional work experience in areas of accounting, budget preparation, maintaining expense, revenues, and general ledgers, or computerized accounting systems.
A master's degree in an area listed above may be substituted for one (1) year of the work experience requirement.

Acuity is seeking a Data Scientist to work with business leaders to inform company strategies and decision-making through an objective viewpoint by leveraging the team’s expertise in deep business knowledge, leveraging data as an asset, and utilizing statistical and advanced analytical techniques as appropriate. The role of Data Scientist uses advanced statistical and analytical techniques to inform highly complex and sophisticated business questions. The data scientist will apply and integrate advanced statistical, mathematical, data mining, and business analysis skills and techniques to discover new behavioral insights, predict outcomes, prescribe decision options, and advise on turning new insights into actionable opportunities. Hybrid work flexibility; a combination of Sheboygan headquarter and remote work.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Develop solutions, to support analytic insights and visualization using mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning techniques, and robust analytics
Partner with business clients and technical leaders to spearhead the development of standards for appropriate statistical methodology, study design, power and sample size estimation, and data analysis plans for behavioral analytics.
Provide data driven decision support for key initiatives of company strategy and measurement related to client, claims, sales, and campaign analyses to understand both growth and economic impact.
Determine requisite data elements and partners with data engineers to design integrated datasets for analytical research purposes.
Work closely with machine learning engineers and business partners to develop and build behavioral data science and analytics products.
Effectively present analytical results and derived recommendations for action to senior leaders, peers, and product team members.
Regular and predictable attendance.
Performs other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, math, computer science, economics, or related field. Advanced graduate level degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, econometrics, or a related field) is preferred.

EXPERIENCE:

A minimum of three years relevant experience to include research and data analysis, experiment design and measurement, or application of statistical research techniques.

OTHER:

Expertise in one or more development or statistical analysis tool such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, SPSS, or other tools. Tableau experience is a plus.
Proven excellence in research, quantitative analysis, problem solving, and analytical working techniques.
Statistical knowledge and intuition
Strong aptitude and desire for learning new analytical and visualization tools, modeling, and quantitative techniques. Initiative to independently design and develop own deliverables while still being a team player.
Demonstrates ability to deliver results and recommendations in written, verbal and presentation form at an appropriate level for a business audience.

This job is classified as exempt.

The Data Business Analyst Senior ensures progressive delivery of data products that meet customer/end user requirements and deliver value to RRX operations, management, and functions. This role will help in development of a vision for the data product, communicating that vision to the Scrum team, being responsible for the product features from concept to end-of-life. This role coordinates with Key Process Owner, Architects, customer, and development teams to ensure that business, quality, and functional goals are met with each product release. The Data Business Analysts use the data analysis process to understand, interpret, and predict patterns in business, and then use those data-driven insights to enhance their business practices
Key responsibilities
Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and work with technical architects, product owners in developing and implementing solutions
Coordinate with Product Architects, and key Process Owner, team to translate business requirements into business and technical features
Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies
Stay up to date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems; work closely with Product owners in defining the product backlog and long-term product strategy
Collaborate with development teams to ensure they understand the product vision and are designing valuable features for regal Rexnord operations and functions
Develop detailed specifications for product features, making sure they are understood by the development teams
Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
Act as an ambassador for data product internally and externally, as well as primary technical contact for queries related to the product
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and users, ensure product meets user specifications, perform and felicitate user acceptance testing
Collaborate with key stakeholders across the company to ensure successful product releases
Ensure consistency and compatibility with all other system technology components
Assist in developing the MDM data model and architecture
Review and validates master data models with stakeholders and subject matter experts.
Qualifications and Requirements
Must have experience in working as a Business Analyst in Demand to Deliver domain (Purchase to pay, source to contract, Warehouse and logistics management)
BA/BS Degree in Operations Research, Statistics, Industrial Engineering, Predictive Analytics, Business Analytics or the equivalent
Four-year degree in either Information Management or Business Administration
A minimum of 8 years of business analysis with at least 3 years in supply chain management
Minimum 2 years of statistical experience (creating attribution models, A/B tests or lift analysis)
Experience in business optimization, problem-solving, or strategic solution roles with progressive responsibility, preferably within the supply chain industry
Experience gathering and consolidating requirements from cross-functional groups
Ability to work under pressure and meet constantly changing timelines
Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Exceptional process and organizational skills with the ability to mobilize change
Experience with a scripting/templating language (Python)
Must have experience in database skills (SQL queries)
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (PowerBI or Tableau or equivalent)
Experience working in demand planning and supplier management software like (DOMO)
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of (Salesforce, Oracle, SAP )
Experienced in both lean and agile methodologies, familiarity with (Jira, Microsoft ADO)
Familiar with version control tools such as (GITHUB, SVN) and proper branching techniques
Experience working with data warehouses (Snowflake, Azure data warehouse)
Key competencies in data science technologies
Commercial and current market trend awareness
Data requirements & confidence working with complex data and systems
Data quality and compliance e.g. scorecard management
Data management principles
Business process management & an understanding of how IT can be used to resolve problems
Mapping value chain (process flow map)
Data stewardship, strategy and governance
Change management process (Vertical & horizontal traceability)

Spending accounts (HSA, Health Care FSA and Dependent Care FSA)
Paid Time Off and Holidays

About Regal Rexnord

Regal Rexnord Corporation (“Regal Rexnord”) is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food & beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. Regal Rexnord is a $7.2B company with 36,000 associates globally.
You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used.
Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Regal Rexnord is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, ancestry, national origin, marital status, citizenship status (unless required by the applicable law or government contract), disability or protected veteran status or any other status or characteristic protected by law. Regal Rexnord is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are committed to building a team that represents diverse and inclusive backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement or similar contract and approval from HR to submit resumes for a specific requisition, Regal Rexnord will not consider or approve payment to any third-parties for hires made.

The Senior Business Analyst is a key liaison between IT and business unit leaders, project managers, key stakeholders, and end users to understand their business challenges and IT delivery capabilities to provide IT solutions. The Senior Business Analyst is a key factor in the development of functional requirements, determining impact to business objectives, and improving/enhancing organizational performance. The Senior Business Analyst leads cross-functional teams to address business or systems issues, to include thinking outside-the-box when proposing solutions.

Job Functions:

Promotes and fosters a safe and secure operating environment.
Establishes and maintains relationships with unit leaders, end-users, IT engineering and software development groups.
Facilitates business unit status meetings, annual budget meetings and training to stay up to date with functional area activities, goals, and system plans.
Manages and assists business unit's staff with analysis, support, documentation, monitoring, testing, and troubleshooting of all systems.
Consults with business unit leaders to identify and expedite high value solutions, business case development, required project documentation and soliciting vendor choices in coordination with strategic sourcing.
Meets with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, operational requirements, and systems goals, to identify and resolve systems issues.
Performs cost-benefit and return on investment analysis for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
Facilitates project meetings with project team regularly to review project deliverables, and team performance to ensure that the deadlines are met.
Collaborates in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, systems, and enhancements to existing applications for improving or further leveraging of systems and enhancing business processes and information process flow.
Coordinates and performs in-depth tests, orientation, training, and end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support.
Leverages Microsoft platform (SharePoint, Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing) to drive process improvement and align with company goals among the planks of performance, economic efficiency, and service.
Provide on-call support, as necessary.

Required Competencies:

Effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Judgment and initiative are needed to arrive at resolution of problems at hand in a reasonable amount of time and in setting priorities in order to meet deadlines for various projects and tasks.
Must be self-driven and able to work with ambiguous requirements with little or no guidance.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Ability to communicate fluently in English.

Education & Experience:

Required:

Associate’s, Bachelor’s or Masters’s degree in computer science, technology, telecommunications, business or related 5-7 years of experience in IT.
5 years’ experience in information technology.
3 years’ project management experience.

Preferred:

3 year’s airline industry experience beneficial
Problem Solving
Analytical Ability
Interpersonal Skills
Communication Skill

Benefits offered to you:

A comprehensive benefits package which includes health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, and health & wellness incentives.
Flight benefits on our partner carrier(s).
Paid holidays, sick leave and vacation.

Job Title: Sr. Business Process Analyst- Jira & Power BI (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Auto req ID: 23020
Title: Sr. Business Process Analyst- Jira & Power BI (Hybrid)
Job Function: Engineering
Location: PDC
Company: Harley-Davidson Motor Company
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Shift: SHIFT1


At Harley-Davidson, we are building more than machines. It’s our passion and commitment to continue the evolution of this storied brand, and heighten the desirability of the Harley-Davidson experience. To keep building our legend and leading our industry through innovation, evolution, and emotion we need the best and brightest talent. We stand for the timeless pursuit of adventure. Freedom for the soul. Are you ready to join us?


The Harley-Davidson Motor Company Product Development Center (PDC) located in Wauwatosa, WI is home to the mantra – You dream it. We build it. Join our team as a Sr. Business Process Analyst- Jira & Power BI (Hybrid).

Job Summary

The Sr. Business Process Analyst leads the management and analysis of program data to enable informed, data-driven decision-making. Partner with Program Managers and project team to drive clarity and common understanding of program health and build readiness.

Job Responsibilities

WHAT You Do (key outputs you’re personally accountable for to ensure program success):

Tools: Focused primarily on Power BI & Jira as well as Teams/SharePoint.
Jira: Admin role experience preferred. Experience creating Filters with JQL and Basic, Dashboard Gadget Experience and Knowledge of backend Workflow creation and impact.
Power BI: Knowledge and experience in the tool leveraging data sets outside of the tool and merging relevant data together to support information and report out needs.
Teams/SharePoint: Experience using the tool primarily for communication and file sharing.
Metrics & Data: Transform available data into automatic report-outs that monitor critical metrics identified by the operating model team that highlight the progress of key deliverables, generating early insights, and reflecting overall program health and build readiness.

HOW You Work (additional ways you influence the program and the company):

Program Culture: Consistently center the team on what is most important and WHY. Mitigate dysfunction and waste by continually refining program operations to ensure efficient and effective execution (e.g., process, tools, communications). Clarify who is responsible for deliverables and timing. Empower individuals and get decisions made at the lowest level practical and ensure all stakeholders at all levels embrace their primary role.
Engagement: Build critical cross-functional support and alliances to drive engagement and energy. Amid the chaos, lead by example, provide stable ground, drive progress, and celebrate wins!
Help Chain: Ensure every team member has the knowledge, tools, and direction to be successful via program onboarding, training, etc. Identify and fill gaps by connecting individuals with relevant experts for help.

Education Requirements
Bachelor's Degree Preferred
Education Specifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Business, or related area.

Experience Requirements
The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of related experience. In addition, they will have demonstrated the following:
Ability to manage, track, and communicate technical information in a clear, concise, and understandable manner to a broad group of stakeholders.
Proven experience in successfully leading complex projects with proficiency in the use of program management methodologies and tools to deliver on time and within budget.
Creative approach to assessing project management best practices and inspiring others to continuously improve processes and how we work.
Success coordinating teams of internal stakeholders to drive organizational change.
Ability to lead and influence cross-functional team members without direct authority.
Proficient in Jira, Power BI, and Teams.

We believe in fairness and providing a level playing field for all. We foster a culture that thrives on diverse perspectives and contributions to ignite the creativity and innovation to fuel our business and enhance the employee and customer experience.

With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.
We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!
Job Description
Reporting to the Manager, Sales Incentive Operations we have a newly created opportunity for a Sales Incentive Analyst
Calculates commission/incentive award payments to sales personnel based on commission plan provisions.
Performs staff support activities needed for the development, implementation, communication and administration of sales commission or incentive programs, plans, policies and quotas.
Reviews commission payment reports for accuracy and completeness.
Able to verify and follow through, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of commission payments as outlined in the plan.
Resolves reconciliation issues.
Typically maintains or audits information needed to track revenue.
May analyze sales performance results, prepare commission expense reports, presentations and recommendations for sales and/or finance management.
Typically uses spreadsheets, ERP systems or dedicated computer programs to gather data for payment calculation or analysis.
May contribute to the development or improvement of systems to effectively track or capture data.
May perform cost analysis or modeling of alternative commission/incentive plan design or quota levels.
Basic Qualifications
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visa, now or in the future, for this job opening.
Typically requires a minimum of 2 years of related experience.
What We Offer:
Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision
401k

HOW YOU WILL DO IT
Purpose Statement: This particular role will focus within the Finance and Accounting space. JD Edwards experience is preferred, but alternate ERP Finance experience will be considered. Business Analysts provide Customer Service Excellence by helping customers implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way, determining the requirements of a project or program, communicating them clearly to stakeholders and solutions development, and helping end users test and deploy the solutions.
Key Job Accountabilities:
Work with business partners to elicit high-level requirements and business needs, followed by articulating those into documented business requirements and demands. Assist with prioritization exercises by providing cost and effort estimation/analysis. Manage the priority of demands to map them appropriately into a process focused functionality roadmap.
Contribute as a global team member as part of the overall application delivery process. Represent customers by collaborating with all IT Teams (e.g. Infrastructure, Development, Support) to ensure that business requirements are understood and that solutions meet expectations.
Understand business processes and systems for assigned customer areas and act as a liaison for the customer area between IT, product teams, and the customer.
Manage and successfully deliver high complexity projects. At times may provide and lead the direction of others. Assist with the onboarding of new Business Analysts. Consider enterprise-wide solutions and impact.
Additional Accountabilities:
Create detailed process diagrams to demonstrate desired functionality (as needed) and participate in requirements reviews and walkthroughs to communicate customer needs and expectations and assist in coordination of User Acceptance testing (UAT).
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that solutions support Plexus and customer policies surrounding key controls and compliance, such as SOX, ITAR, EAR, FDA, and others as appropriate by properly specifying these needs as part of the overall delivery of requirements.
Technical Currency: Remain current on Plexus business, industry and IT technology trends in order to provide forward looking solutions
Focus on continuous improvement - personal, the team, and processes. Develop, discuss and adapt to those enhancements and changes.
Actively lead Functional User Groups and similar meetings by sharing common problems and solutions across multiple sites/regions and providing user request updates.
Additional duties as assigned.

A minimum of a Bachelor’s is required.
2-5 years of related experience is required. Fewer years of IT experience will be considered if candidates have Finance and/or Accounting experience.
CBAP certification achieved or expected within role
Agile and Lean Six Sigma certifications are desirable
An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the key job accountabilities may be considered.
Experience in computing systems or IT support is highly desirable

This Corporate Risk Intelligence Analyst II role with Associated Bank will support the efforts to solve meaningful financial crimes problems. This role helps to identify and prevent fraud and money laundering by ensuring Corporate Risk system, data and reporting needs are met. This individual will be engaged in every step of the process for Corporate Risk Management projects including requirements gathering, solutioning, query building, and testing.

This person will:

Be a change agent. Identify opportunities for improvement and efficiency while supporting the needs of all areas of the Corporate Risk Management department.
Support Corporate Risk Management (CRM) projects by writing and reviewing business and design requirements, developing test cases, perform testing and provide implementation support.
Analyze and support data and reporting requirements for corporate risk solutions including management and board reporting as well as data needs for regulatory and audit requests.
Analyze and recommend system configurations, forms, modeler and other business line configurations within the CRM applications.
Mine and clean data from multiple sources, then analyze results to identify trends and patterns in order to recommend and configure changes for CRM application parameters leveraging SQL, Excel, Power BI and other tools that support reviewing analytics and metrics.
Develop and maintain strong positive working relationships with lines of businesses, peers, risk management partners, technology partners and senior management.
Develop, manage and evolve documentation to support CRM business processes.
Provide recommendations with clear and concise rationale to defend the change if asked by management, auditors and/or regulators.
Work with technology and serve as business line resource for questions, issues, data needs, configuration, reporting, and general business line support for CRM tools and systems.
Escalate issues and exceptions to management in a timely manner in accordance with procedures and based on sound judgement.
Be flexible as priorities switch based on the needs of the company in a fast-paced environment.
Maintain knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks in support of data, configurations, tuning, reporting, and regulatory requirements.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in Business, risk, compliance, technology, analytics or related field. Required
2-4 years Progressive application, data, and or analytics experience within the financial services and/or BSA / risk / compliance function. Required
4-7 years Progressive application, data, and or analytics experience within the financial services BSA / risk / compliance function. Preferred
CAMS, Fraud, Risk, PMP, or other certification in support of technology, data, analysis or risk based functions within 3-5 years. Preferred

A successful person in this role will need to have:

Experience with business analytics, mining data, data requirements gathering and testing.
Experience working with Snowflake, Oracle, SQL or similar databases and strong query writing skills.
Ability to grasp complex concepts quickly and identify risks and compensating controls.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and results orientated; able to make decisions independently.
Strong analytical skills/research skills coupled with the ability to effectively summarize findings.
Experience working on initiatives that require strategic planning and thinking.
Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment.
2-4 years of data and/or business analysis experience within the financial services BSA / risk / compliance function.

Job Title: Associate Manager, SAP Finance Business Analyst
Job Description:
SC JOHNSON IS A FIFTH-GENERATION FAMILY COMPANY BUILT ON THE SPIRIT OF OUR PEOPLE. We have been leading with purpose for over 130 years, building iconic brands that win the hearts and minds of consumers – such as Raid®, Glade®, Ziploc® and more, in virtually every country around the world. Together, we are creating a better future – for the planet, for future generations and for every SCJ team member. Join our winning team of Wave Makers and Go Getters and help us write the next chapter in the SCJ story.

As the Associate Manager, SAP Finance Business Analyst, you will be primarily focusing on managing the finance related business requirements and technical solutions with the detailed duties and responsibilities listed below.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Support the finance domain architect as the application and process SME for any finance application portfolios assigned to this role

Provide inputs to the application lifecycle management, problem management, process improvements and roadmap considerations to support the company business strategy and business operations

Maintain the knowledge repositories for various domain related processes and solutions implemented in the systems

Support business demand intake by analyzing business requirements and provide input on the scope assessment for any potential system changes or additions

For assigned projects, analyze and document business requirements. Work with the business and technical team to design and implement business processes and technical solutions to achieve optimized business goals according to the project plan

This role will be key business liaison to make sure the solutions are properly implemented to meet business requirements. From time to time, this role may also need to work with 3rd party consultants delivering results for one or multiple projects

Responsible for providing governance and control for various change requests to the SCJ production systems to ensure system integrity

Provide functional specification approval for minor enhancements to be implemented by AMS team

Provides SME support for critical P1 incidents escalation

Required Skills / Experience / Competencies:

Bachelor’s degree in business, IT, related field or military experience considered in lieu of education requirement

5+ years of experience with SAP FI/CO with combination of project implementations and support

1+ years of experience with finance processes and in-depth technical knowledge in General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable and Tax, including configuration and preparing functional specifications for development

Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States

Preferred Skills / Experience / Competencies:

Experienced in supporting Sovos or other tax compliance solutions

Experienced in working with BPC for consolidation

Experienced in working with SAP interfacing with other systems

Knowledge of other SAP processes, preferable SD billing and procurement

Experience managing small projects

Self-starter and fast learner and be able to adapt to the fast-changing environment

Strong problem-solving skills

Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization as well as with external vendors

Job Requirements:

Full time with occasional operational support outside core business hours

Ability to travel when conditions return to normal ~10%

Remote work is available once a week for eligible employees

Company Name: International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans
Job Description:
Description:

Position Summary:

Oversees and manages the activities of the Applications Team (reports, maintenance, analysis, testing, and implementation of software applications) and Programming Team (reporting, systems analysis, design, writing/coding, and programming services) for the International Foundation.

While a leadership role for the International Foundation with strategic responsibilities, the incumbent could conduct tactical (operational) work in both functional areas, as needed to support the team and meet business objectives and deadlines.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

This Position Description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

In partnership with the Director of IT and IT management, establish strategy and operational objectives and deliverables for the functional areas of responsibility.
Monitor operational metrics and processes, and implement standard methodologies, tools and best practices to ensure high-quality deliverables.
Utilize business analytics to transform raw data into business insights that are useful for decision making and strategic planning.
Support multiple development and/or reporting projects with scheduling, planning, resource allocation, and reporting.
Establish relationships and work closely with external vendors.
Foster a collaborative culture of open performance feedback and accountability to achieve excellence. This could include: conducting frequent individual and team coaching, leveraging mentorship relationships, and creating peer work-review opportunities.
Conduct regular assessments and evaluations of software programs and new technology.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position is a functional/departmental manager of both operations, processes and people within the Applications Analyst and Programming Analyst teams.

The Programmer Analyst team is responsible to:

Coordinate systems analysis and design for various departments
Design and maintain programs (AMS, SQL, etc.) including writing, coding, testing, and analyzing software programs and/or applications
Design and maintain all requested reports (AMS, SQL, SRS, Visual Studio, PowerBI, etc.)
Conduct database modeling and design/develop SSIS and SSAS
Assist end-users (in-house) in diagnosing, problem-solving and correcting errors
Assist with testing, installing upgrades for software and hardware, etc.

The Applications Analyst team is responsible to:

Provide assistance for necessary software and/or hardware updates, especially as it relates to third-party software programs.
Design and maintain all necessary reports as requested, including reports necessary for the association management software (AMS), using MS Reporting Services (SRS), Visual Studio and other available tools.
Liaison with the developers of third-party software packages to resolve any problems that may arise.
Collaboratively support all departments with the utilization of third party software programs.
Assist the Programmer Analyst team to design and maintain all requested reports in various programs (AMS, SRS, Visual Studio, PowerBI, etc.)
Draft and maintain SOP documentation for the Applications team functions.
Requirements:

Required Education/ Experience:

A bachelor’s degree in Informational Technologies, Computer Science (or similar) with a minimum of 5 combined years’ relevant experience conducting Business Analysis, Programmer Analyst and/or Applications Analyst responsibilities, through which a comprehensive knowledge of the functional area has been developed.
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a supervisory position with at least 2 direct reports.

The International Foundation will always consider candidates with an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.

Minimum Qualifications/Skills:

In addition to the above-listed required education and experience minimums, candidates must possess the following minimum qualifications and skills:

Proficiency in Microsoft Office and knowledge of Microsoft CRM Dynamics
Ability to provide a positive customer service experience and show good time management skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven experience in management of major software development projects.
Extensive experience with Application development methodologies, technologies (languages, databases, tools).
Knowledgeable in the areas of software testing methodologies and testing frameworks.
Well-versed in Data Modeling, SQL, and SQL Server technologies.
Demonstrated talent in exercising and promoting accountability as well as resolving conflict.
Experience utilizing interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.

Additional Beneficial Skills:

Virtual and cloud technology knowledge or experience
Power BI/Power Apps
MS Visual Studio
.NET, C#, MVC
XML Services
SSRS, SSIS

Travel Requirements:

This position may intermittently require that the individual travel for work to support organizational events or initiatives; but not to exceed 10% of the time.

Hybrid Work Environment:

This position is expected to work from our corporate headquarters office in Brookfield, WI. This is an environment with typical office conditions, including lighting, noise, seating, and equipment. New hires are expected to be fully onsite during the training period. Then, once fully trained, the Foundation operates on a 60/40 Hybrid schedule; with 60% being onsite at our headquarters in Brookfield (Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays); and up-to 40% being optionally remote (Mondays and Fridays) and as business needs allow.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus.

COMPENSATION, PERKS & BENEFITS:

Comp: Compensation range starts at $90,000, based on experience.

Our incredible benefits package includes a comprehensive medical plan, vision plan, dental plan, long term disability, short term disability, paid vacation, sick and paid holidays. Our retirement plan includes a defined benefit (pension) plan AND a non-elective company 401(k) contribution AND a 401(k) matching contribution. Unique organizational perks include on-site fitness center with yoga and strength training classes, mindfulness sessions, a bocce league, softball team, and even a cribbage club to name a few!

ABOUT US:

The International Foundation of Employee Benefit Plans is North America’s largest membership organization for those who work with employee benefit plans. The Foundation’s employees make a HUGE impact on the livelihoods of millions of workers across the U.S. and Canada because of the work we do in providing education and research to the benefits community. Employees enjoy an outstanding benefits package, unique employee perks, creative and caring co-workers—all within a family-friendly workplace. Speaking of workplaces, the Foundation is tucked into a 15-acre wooded slice of nature in the heart of Brookfield. We’re small enough for you to have ongoing, meaningful impact on the organization but big enough to make international news. Visit us at www.ifebp.org or connect with us on the socials.
